description:
The Lobsta Truck is the Bomb!

I stumbled upon this truck at 400 California at lunch time. Given that I love lobster rolls I had to give it a try.

First off, it is a traditional east  coast lobster roll. The kind that you would find out on Long Island or Boston or Maine. Split top bun toasted in butter, lobster meat with a choice of either butter or seasoned mayo. That's it. No lettuce, no tomato, nothing else. This is not a Chicago hot dog it is a lobster roll. I went with the traditional butter and for the extra meat option for $6 more. The regular is $14. Perfection! Bun Perfect. Lobster meat was impeccably fresh, tender and succulent -- Perfect. Did I say it was perfect? Sorry no picture -- it did not last long enough.

As for the Yelpers with their low ratings primarily about the size or the cost, I am sorry to put it this way, but what planet are you from?! This is fresh chunked lobster, not tuna salad. Lukes Lobster, the lobster shack that I judge all grab and go lobster rolls by is $16 in Las Vegas and New York City for 4 oz of meat on a split top butter toasted bun. This is San Francisco and the Lobsta Truck's roll is $14! 

If you want a sit down place, check out Waterbar, Leo's Oyster Bar or Sauce Belden. All are excellent, perhaps a little more meat but you better be prepared to anti up some real coin -- $25 - 35 range plus all of the costs of eating in a restaurant. Lobster Me on the other hand is $24 and is the worst lobster roll I have ever had. Bun was stale and I swear the meat was previously frozen or just old -- defiantly not fresh. It is in a food court setting though, so if you are looking for a plastic chair and a table that was cleaned a couple of hours ago whether it needed it or not and surrounded by screaming kids have at it.

The Lobsta Truck is a bargain for those that know what a true lobster roll should be.
author: John C.

description:
Native New Englander here, family from New Hampshire, Maine and Boston. These are the real thing, folks. Everything is simple, fresh, and authentic. I'm a lobster with mayonaise person, my spouse a lobster with butter person. No fillers, no silly arugula or weird sauces or strange herbs that people who have never eaten a lobster roll at Brant Rock or in Bar Harbor or Hampton Beach in their lives make up in their Hollywood heads and then charge big bucks for. I also notice Lobstatruck always has an A rating. Moon pies are also good, if a little too fancy. Only sad they don't serve red top. 

PS the chowder and the bisque are also wicked good.
author: Ess K.

description:
Definitely an okay place to eat at. Usually you can find them at an Off the Grid event. I knocked off the point for the size and not having the most memorable experience. I'm not a believer in over dressing seafood however, I should of looked up the reviews and went with extra butter and some mayo (this might of made a huge difference). 

Understandably, this price is justified with the great lobster meat. Mind you, most places in SF charge in between 18 to 25 for a lobster roll roughly this size as well. 

It was good enough for me to want to finish it. However, not great to the extent that I would buy it again.
author: Ann N.

description:
Struggling between a 2 and 3 star rating, soooooo... let's call it 2.5 stars and rate it a 3 here since it was "edible"...

Do I love me some lobsta?! Yes, indeed I do. Did I love the lobsta from the "Lobsta Truck"?! Um... naw, not really. I didn't "love" it, but when you're hangry... anything goes. 

It was a Wednesday evening... aka lobster truck night for yours truly, and I set out to get my lobster truck fix at the Off the Grid one night. I frequent the Cousin's Maine Lobster truck religiously, so I came with the intention of grabbing a lobster roll from my old and faithful. 

To my dismay, lil ol' Cousin's wasn't there that night. You could say that I had a minor heart attack after that realization... and then I saw it: the "Lobsta" truck. I hadn't remembered ever trying it before, so I was excited to try a roll from a newbie. To my surprise, there was only one person ahead of me.

 I examined the menu and noticed that they carried many favorites; lobster rolls, clam chowder, and lobster bisque. The lobster roll was $14 which is actually cheaper than Cousin's $17 price tag. That was a good sign in itself... or so I thought. I put my order in at the window and the kind lady who took my order gave me a number. I ordered a single lobster roll and decided to get a snack from another truck to go along with it.

It didn't take long for my order and when I received it, I noticed that the lobster looked... different. Visually, it wasn't the most appealing. I was hungry... I'm sorry, I was "hangry", so I didn't really wasn't worried too much about how it looked. 

I took my first bite and I can't really say what it was, but something just tasted off. The flavor was just... weird. It almost tasted like imitation lobster. The consistency was unusual and the lobster didn't taste the freshest. I could taste the butter and I did really enjoy the crispy roll, but it did nothing to mask that unusual taste. It wasn't gross but it just didn't taste... right. Maybe it wasn't fresh?! It definitely wasn't what I was used to. The portion size was also pretty small for the price.  

When I was done eating it, I felt the urge to gargle or to eat something else to get that taste out of my mouth. I guess I'm just spoiled by Cousin's Maine because the Lobsta Truck's rolls can't even touch the quality of Cousin's rolls. I'm hoping that it was just an off day for them, but I'll probably just continue to go to Cousin's in the meantime. The  quality and taste of their lobster rolls are just so much better in my opinion.
author: Shayla B.

description: 4 stars for the food, 2 stars for the portion and price :/ delicious lobster, but could have eaten 2-3 of them to be comfortably full!
author: Shin M.

description: $14 for tasteless crab slapped onto a small slice of Texas toast that was slathered in butter.  The crab could have used some seasoning, at least some Old Bay.  Also, the sandwich was small.  Will never come back to this truck!
author: Nikki M.

description: I was so excited to eat a lobster roll, this was heartbreaking. Exaggerating, hyperbole you say? Naw, I cried after. This was not a diamond in the rough, this place was extremely expensive and even if it was not over priced, the food was not quality. I guess they stay open because dumb dumbs like me are willing to try this place because they are e excited to eat lobster and don't look at yelp reviews.
author: Melissa R.

description:
Decent, if petite lobster rolls. At $14 each, they're not as egregiously priced as those of, say, Sam's Chowdermobile, but the serving size is a hot dog bun that, depending on the generosity or attention span of the server, can be stuffed with lobster filling or can be rather stingy with it.

It's all an OK treat, but if you have $14 to spend at a food truck festival, you might be able to get better value at other trucks.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Not worth the money!
13 bucks for half a cup of completely tasteless crab meat slapped on a single slice of toast, for which I waited about 15 minutes even though there was practically no line.
author: Leslie V.

description: Excellent taste but pricy for a food cart and small portions. I was starving so i opted for the 21 buck lobster roll with extra meat added. Presentation and taste were great but finished it in a couple bits and needed to get a 2nd lunch elsewhere. It felt more like a snack. I understand the going rate for lobster but one expects a hook up from a food cart. Maybe if it had fries or something else filling included with it the meal would be more well rounded.
author: Sean G.

description:
The lobster roll with added meat was great

I had it it with mayo and the nice man working there, suggested a drizzle of butter on top

Loved it

$21
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Off grid often has food trucks during lunch time near by my office. So I came to the food trucks after 1pm and Lobsta was the only one that didn't have to wait. As expected, i got the food real fast. I can never have enough lobster rolls, but this is the worst one ever had. Here's what I think about the food, 

1) The bread was ok but they put too much butter so it's quite oily. 2) it's a really really small roll, not as big as a Asian female's palm. The smallest ever had. 3) it's $14+tax, total $15.3. I can get a really good and reasonable size lobster roll at wood house fish company or crabsters for less than $3 more and way better. 4) not much lobster in there, part of the lobster taste either not fresh or didn't cook well. 

Although the cook was pretty nice and wrapped my roll with tin foil since I couldn't hold the paper plate, I would never recommend this place if you are trying to get a reasonable priced lunch.
author: Gemma C.

description: Not bad! The lobster roll was delicious and very much like the one I had in Boston. I got the spiced mayo on the side and it was a very nice addition. However, for $15.56 (including tax) the portion you get is TINY. This is more like a snack than a full meal. I know this is SF but the value really isn't there to justify the price, unfortunately. See photo below with the small spoon for comparison.
author: Cameron C.

description: I love lobster rolls. So I had to try this one. It was good, but it is on the rather small side.  I opted for butter on a lobster roll w/ extra lobster meat for $21. and some change.  Don't think I'm coming back because it was truly sooooo small and I'm still super hungry.  Friendly staff...no line...
author: Jill P.

description:
I was at the Sunnyvale Off The Grid , Perusing the Lineup Of Food Trucks.  This is when I ran into the Lobsta Truck !!! Being a Baller On A Budget , I love Lobster !!!

So I perused the Lobsta Truck Menu .  This is when I spotted a Naked Lobster Roll for $14 .
So I ordered 1 . I was given the option of having it with Mayonnaise Or Butter . I opted for Butter .

6 Minutes later I had a Butter Dressed Lobster Roll . It looked Good the only thing I didn't like was the portion size the Lobster Roll was on the Small size for the price.  

Quality was there as the Lobster was cooked just right and the Roll was nicely Toasted . 

The Lobster Roll tasted great . 

A few minutes later my Ankle bracelet went off and I had too leave.

I would eat at the Lobsta Truck again if I had a Lobster Craving and needed to Satisfy it .
author: Eugene L.

description:
So 2 things. 
1.The lobster sandwich was really chewy and I could not even eat it. I purchased the sandwich from off the grid @ Fort Mason on Friday 8/4/17. Total Waste of money.
2. Not only was it a waste of money but they overcharged me. The female cashier did not give me a receipt but told me it was $15 and some change which makes sense if the sandwich is 14 plus tax. Please explain how a $14 dollar sandwich ended up costing $17.55. Poor business practices
author: M B.

description:
I went to Off the Grid in Larkspur and had the Lobsta Truck's lobsta roll with butter for $14.  It is as small as people have said it is in their reviews, and I was done eating it in lickety split.  I found it to be very tasty, though, and I did not feel like I was starving after I finished eating it.  Plus, it is the perfect size for someone like myself who is trying to watch their figure :p  I did not get any sides, but I did have some crackers of my own that I ate with my sandwich.  

If the service were friendlier, I'd give it a higher rating, but unfortunately, it was not.  I opted not to add tip onto my card payment as I planned on giving a cash tip, but after receiving cold treatment when I placed my order and paid, I decided to wait to see if it would be any better at pick-up.  Well, people who placed their order after me got served before I did, I'm guessing because they gave tips at payment.  I have to report service was no better at pick-up either; hence, the three stars instead of four I would give just for the roll itself.
author: Carnita M.

description:
Every time I go to one of these food truck gatherings, I feel compelled to try a different truck. I like lobster rolls, so naturally I was drawn to this truck.

$14 Lobsta Roll - fresh Maine lobster on toasted split top roll w/ butter:
The price is pretty good for a lobster roll, if you do a little price comparison with the other lobster rolls on the market. I'm not sure what happened, but mine was a little soggy. The roll, albeit buttery, was deflated and absorbed too much moisture. The lobster could have used a little more seasoning. However, there were nice big chunks of lobster stuffed into the roll, so that was great.
author: Joy W.

description:
Made it to Fridays OTG at Fort Mason, knowing it's lent Fridays the Lobsta truck sounds amazing. Luckily there wasn't a long line of people due to we thought it was suppose to storm but rain or shine they will be there. 
Choices?? Lobster or Crab sammich or soup?? 
Hmm.. I'll take the lobster, extra meat for $$ na I'll just stick to the regular with butter on a top slice roll. Done within 5mins. My first bite was amazing, that Maine lobster was Phat!! But sadly I finished it in 4 bites. It is small but very good. 

Thanks Lobsta truck!
author: Kathy V.

description:
As a native New Englander,  I was so excited when I was this truck parked outside my office.  "Lobsta" is one of my favorite things on the planet -- but it's really hard for me to find lobster that is actually good in the Bay.  I will say, this lobster tastes pretty great.  It tasted fresher than what I usually find around here, and it was awesome.

I got the lobster roll with extra meat, and I did the butter (no mayo).  The lobster roll was small, which they usually are...I mean it's lobster, its expensive -- you're not paying for a cheeseburger here.  Oh -- the roll was toasted perfectly, and it was buttery -- so delicious!  I also got Cape Cod Chips and a small lobster bisque -- which was really good too.

I definitely recommend trying this place, but I will admit it is not cheap, but its lobster guys -- come on.  Honestly, best lobster roll I've had in the Bay Area.
author: Michelle S.

description:
There wasn't a long line waiting to order at the Lobsta truck at Off the Grid in Pleasant Hill, which surprised me. Their prices are higher than the other trucks, however, lobster is expensive and the rolls are nowhere near as pricey as they are at a sit-down restaurants charge. 

I'm not much of a lobster fan. S loves this shellfish, so, I ordered a roll with butter to-go; it did not make in home intact.  The small bite I sampled tasted fresh. I worked at rearranging the lobster in the roll so it was not apparent that I had tasted anything, and it seemed to me that it was a good value. I took home the doctored roll, S thought it was great. I suspect that I will bring another one home, and perhaps order one for myself.
author: Terry T.

description:
Came here for quick bite for lunch with my boyfriend. It was near his office so we decided to give it a try.

We had the lobster roll, calm chowder and lobster bisque. The soups were okay, I prefer the calm chowder more than the lobster bisque, it had more flavoring. Lobster roll was mediocre and pricey. Not worth your dollar dollar bills ya'll. It's pretty small and not enough lobster. I mean I know lobster is expensive these days, but I expected more since it was more on the pricey side.

Overall, go to New England lobster, you can get a big lobster roll with cole slaw and chips for around $19!
author: Natalie L.

description: Sandwich is tiny for the price. It was literally 4-5 bites. This would not even fill up my 3yr old. It needed seasoning and it wasn't worth the 4 blocks I walked to get it..
author: Ayana K.

description:
I arrived at their Front St. location and was expecting a long line but apparently, it was pretty short. I was having trouble deciding on the lobster roll or the bisque and ultimately went with the  $13 bisque because it was a gloomy day and thinking a bisque would be perfect for the weather. Once I dug my spoon in, my day remained gloomy! I kept fishing and fishing and not one single lobster meat in sight. Am I spoiled because every other lobster joint I've visited usually have chunks of lobster in the bisque? Anyhow, I took a bite and then finally realize there's little grindy texture of lobster in it, but it is really real fresh lobster? Who knows because I can't even really taste the lobster! It smelled and tasted like a bit of alcoholic, is it suppose to taste like that? It's super watery and oily at the same time. Too much cream/milk. I should have went for the $14 lobster roll instead so at least I could have a more fulfilling bite from the overpriced roll. Super upset and unsatisfied.

This is going to go down in history as one of my biggest life regrets. I shall share this story to my great children one day.....
author: Elaine Y.

description:
When you can't get to Maine in time, Lobsta Truck is almost the next best thing! You can't expect much more in LA where lobster roll seems to be low on demand from all the other amazing goodies there is to offer in LA. 

Will you be full? No, but it will satisfy your lobster roll craving! Simple menu with two types of roll (Lobster $13 or Crab $12) and soup (clam chowder $4-7 or lobster bisque $6-12). Everything else that is offered are chips, whoopie pie, and drinks. 

Overall, a great truck for a quick craving fix! The turnaround time is fast, no complaints! Lobsta Truck has their location updated weekly, so check it out and see if they're in your neighborhood. You won't be disappointed, enjoy!
author: Jen H.

description: For some context, this truck is located about 2 blocks from where I work. Had a lobster roll craving one day so decided to finally check it out. Was debating whether to get the regular or double meat but after seeing someone else's regular and realizing it was so little meat I just went double. Still wasn't substantial enough but with some free chips from the office it was a decent meal. Wouldn't be a regular here but if you really crave a lobster roll, and have 30 mins to get lunch, then yeah this is a solid option
author: Laura D.

description:
YAS!  That's really all that needs to be said.  Having grown up in New England, I am so grateful that San Francisco is finally on to the lobster roll bandwagon.  When I was growing up I'd enjoy lobster rolls by an idyllic Atlantic Ocean beach while in San Francisco I get to munch on my $20 lobster roll a block from all the SROs of 6th Street.  Not quite the same ambiance, but still an amazing lunch.

Lobsta Roll (extra meat) with Drawn Butter: In my homeland of Connecticut, I knew this as merely a lobster roll.  In any other State, I have to specify Connecticut-style to emphasize that it's not that abomination with cold lobster meat and mayonnaise.  Here, they don't try to partake in the debate and just offer the lobster roll both ways: the right way (butter) and the wrong way (mayo).  I upgraded to the extra meat for another $6 (for a grand total for $20/roll) and got a very healthy portion of lobster (compared to lobster roll norms).  They used a split bun and it was lightly toasted on both sides.  This is probably the closest to home I've had while living in California.  My only suggestion would be slightly hotter lobster and a tad more butter, but generally it is well ahead of the competition.

Lobster Bisque: The soup itself was very tasty, creamy and filled with real lobster flavor.  Sadly, there were no bits of lobster floating around (as is sometimes common with lobster bisque).   Was pretty watery and could have used some crackers or bread to make it heartier.
author: Adam B.

description: The food was cold :(. Additionally, it was snack sized at best. The flavor was okay, slightly rubbery, but edible. SUPER expensive if you consider the size.
author: Jazmyn B.

description: Absolutely the most insulting price per portion I've ever witnessed in the city. $15.26 for NOTHING. Please go out of business you crooks.
author: Brandon M.

description:
What a rip off.

There was no line and this should have been my first tip off. 

The portions are super small. It is way to pricey. 

Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Tata S.

description:
Hmm...

The bad- What a let down...my bf asked for extra meat, that was an additional 6 bucks, which made the sandwich a whopping $20 dollars.

With that in mind and going off of the pictures with extra meat, it looks like we got stiffed.

The lobster was over cooked and rubbery. 

The good- the actual toast it was on was crunchy, soft and buttery. The house mayo was really good!!! Tons of flavor and went well with the lobster.

Verdict- I don't know if I'd ever come back for the price of what you get.
author: Jerrica N.

description:
Delicious lobster bisque: 
- Very savory and comes with good amount of seafood bits.

Slightly above-average lobster roll (comparison within SF Bay): 
- $14 for a wimpy looking roll isn't too bad for food truck prices. Lobster tasted decently fresh with a choice of butter or mayo dressing.
author: Tian Q.

description:
This was the absolute worst piece of crap I've ever eaten in my life. Where do I begin. First I requested the large sandwich which was $21. The sandwich was the size of two sliders. I question if it was the large she said "There's extra meat on the small bread". Of course, I get back to my office and that was a lie.

The bread was soggy/mushy.

The "lobster" was soggy/mushy. There were shells in it. It had no flavor and quite honestly had a very fishy (not fresh) smell.

I pray I don't get sick. 

Sam's Chowder is WAYYYYYYYYYYY BETTER!

Lobsta truck isn't fit for human consumption.
author: Sheila C.

description:
Find this guys at of the Grid in San Francisco 
I seriously don't know how the lobsta truck is still on business 
The lobster was really bad , that bad that I actually got sick from 
I'm riding the Bart home to oakland and I can't believe this lobster truck ruined my hole night !
Never again
author: Pablo C.

description: I debated getting a lobsta roll for the longest time. I finally pulled the trigger. The flavor was ok. But MAN do I feel ripped off!!!!! $14 for a tiny little roll that's maaaaaybe worth $10. I've had many lobster rolls in my life. Most are a bit more than $14 but they are definitely very generous with the portions. Lobsta Truck, if you don't start giving more generous portions for the price you charge, you're not surviving for long.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
It was 20-30 minutes in line to order all the way to pick-up.  I won't do it again.  I ate the sandwich in 4 bites.

Truthfully, It wasn't even that great. 

$14 for a mediocre lobster roll. 

Will to go by reviews instead of (filtered) pictures next time around..
author: Angelica C.

description:
Wow, unbelievable this place still in business. Aweful taste makes you want to puke, my buddy actually did puke!
Never again
author: Dean R.

description: This truck is closer to my work for the next two weeks because of the Super Bowl coming into the city. I  decided to try it for lunch today because it sounded appetizing. Although it's a "lobsta" truck I ended up ordering a pint of clam chowder and a fresh squeezed lemonade. The guy informed me they didn't have ice, but the lemonade was still cold enough. The guy was nice but was confused on how to take a cash and credit payment since I was splitting it up. It came out alright and I waited about five minutes to get my food. The clam chowder is fantastic! Not watery at all and very creamy. It was very flavorful and not fishy tasting. It was great and I already wanted to go back and even get more! Perfect food for the cold weather and not too badly priced for the amount you get ($8 bucks). Overall, I'm bound to try this again in the coming week!
author: James R.

description: I and my wife are fan of lobster roll. We hunt this trunk down in Alameda several weeks ago. The experience is way disapoointed. The roll is plain and overpriced. The portion is terribly small. Butter is all you got. No add-ons. We made another trip to the five guys across the alley right after we finished it.
author: T W.

description:
I've had Lobsta Truck many times and I've pretty much always felt the same way. Good food, ridiculous prices. If you want lobster, head to an actual restaurant. 

This time, we got the crab roll (tasted great) and the lobster bisque (awesome). The lobster bisque is very flavorful but I would've loved bigger bits of seafood. Overall, good food.
author: Davelyn C.

description:
Mediocre lobster roll at best, but really just bland and over-priced :(

I consider myself an a-fish-anado of lobster rolls, having spent the first 17 years of my life in New England and eating them with great regularity even now whenever I visit the East Coast.  This, my friends, is NOT the "real deal"!!

I had anticipated something better.  I waited in line for almost 20 minutes.  And I even ordered the "extra lobster meat" option.  But alas, what I received was a barely-filled roll of watery, bland, semi-minced lobster meat.  Sigh.  People, making a proper lobster roll isn't rocket science.  You only need two, maybe three ingredients:  Lobster, mayo or butter, salt.  That's really it.  Okay, some of you like some celery in there...that's okay, I guess, as long as the chunks aren't too big.  But you definitely don't want to add celery seeds or lemon juice or anything excessively pungent like that...Lobster is a subtle, sweet meat, and like many other delicacies from the sea, is easily over-powered by forthright seasonings.

However, this wasn't really a problem here.  The problem was that the meat was flavorless (I'm guessing previously frozen?), watery, and if there was mayo or salt or any seasoning whatsoever, I couldn't really detect it.

And most of all, I was incensed that I paid over $20 for an "extra meat" lobster roll that was barely a regular lobster roll.  Seriously??  I pay $6.50 for a lobster roll that size at Stop & Shop on Martha's Vineyard.  

There's just no good excuse.  I get that it's a delicacy and those cost money.  I get that your meat probably comes from a freezer.  But honestly?  If you're charging that much for a lobster roll, it really should be MUCH better than that one was.

I won't be back to this food truck...I consider it to be a waste of money.  If I need a lobster roll, I'll either pony up the bucks at the Woodhouse Fish Co., or buy a lobster at the Chinese fish store down the street and make it myself.  I guarantee mine will be 1000% tastier than the one I got  from Lobsta Truck!!!
author: Amy L.

description:
As this California girl's quest rages on to find the most authentic Maine lobster roll this side of the Mississippi, Lobsta Truck is a worthy contender!  They are present every other week at Off The Grid Pleasant Hill on Wednesday evenings, and I've enjoyed their rolls many times!  They are an excellent place to get your lobster fix, and trust me, with many pretenders out there, this is extremely high praise.  Lobsta Truck is the real goods!

In terms of authenticity, they are on point - toasted and lightly buttered New England style sandwich rolls, stuffed with large and well-cooked lobster chunks, and you can get it tossed with mayo or butter (Connecticut style).  Their standard roll is $14 and is decent size for the price (for anyone who gripes, lobster is a top shelf item.  It doesn't matter that it's coming off a food truck - this is fresh seafood that has to be flown in from the other side of the damn country, and cooked properly - if you cringe at the price, MOVE ON).  You can get your roll beefed up with some extra lobster for another $6, though I always opt to keep it original - I'm just happy to be getting my fix!  I've devoted a LOT of time, paycheck and gas mileage to seeking out a proper lobster roll, and the wares at Lobsta Truck is worth all of it.  Every other week, I venture down to Off The Grid, order up a lobster roll (or two!) and a bottle of Maine Root blueberry soda, and for those precious bites and sips, I am in true heaven.  

Lobsta Truck is legit, and I thank them for serving up a delicious and authentic product daily!  You keep this California girl very happy!
author: Terri N.

description:
I read about The Lobsta Truck from a few food blogs and heard pretty good things about them.  Like Nom Nom Truck and MeSoHungry, they've come a long way from SoCal.

Basically if you're looking for simple Lobster Rolls with no bells and whistles then this is the truck for you.  Their menu is really straightforward.  For the Rolls you have a choice to pick between Lobster or Crab and to dress it with either Mayo or Butter.  For $13-14 you get a decent sized Roll.  They give you option to add more meat for $5 more if you're really hungry.  But for me, their standard size Rolls are good enough.  They also have Clam Chowder and Lobster Bisque which you can order a cup or a big bowl.

Lobsta Roll with Butter --  http://bit.ly/PVQHRq
I'd probably compare this to Luke's Lobster in NYC.  The brioche roll is slightly smaller than Sam's or New England but they definitely give you a fair share of Lobster.

Crab Roll with Mayo --  http://bit.ly/1glp7ll
For a dollar less, you can pick up the Crab Roll.  Like the Lobster Roll, they give a good amount of lump Crab meat.  This in my opinion is the better of the two.  It might be because I'm more of a Crab fan than a Lobster fan.

I'll have to come back again to try their soups.  I wouldn't mind coming back to visit the Lobsta Truck as their rolls are pretty legit, cheaper than other Lobster Food Trucks, fresh, and rightly sized, especially if you visit them at any Food Truck events.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Before heading to the Lobsta Truck at Off the Grid in Alameda, I read the reviews others had posted on yelp: The sandwich is too small.  It's too much for $14. There was a short wait for food. 

I headed out to see what the fuss was about. I love a good lobster roll so why not? There were about 5 people in front of me and, by the time I ordered my lobster roll with butter, 6 people behind. The cashier was friendly and took my order.  5 minutes later, I was passed my lobster roll. Although it can be considered small, remember that you're buying from a food truck. Most items here are going to be smaller portioned and more expensive. 

I took a bite of the perfectly crispy "bun" (no, it isn't a hot dog bun...think more like a well-defined grilled cheese) and into the lobster. The lobster was fresh with that notable "crunch" that you get when you know your seafood wasn't frozen. It probably took me about 5 or 6 bites to finish it...and then a couple more to eat what had fallen out into the tray. 

Would I go back? Absolutely. $14 is hefty, but for the quality and fast service, it's definitely worth it.
author: Olivia C.

description:
Went to the OTG in Alameda and was on a mission to try food trucks I never tried yet. The lobsta truck caught my attention and sucked me in like tracker beams. I ordered the $14.00 lobster roll and you get a choice of butter and/or mayo so I ordered it with both. The lobster roll were literally the size of sliders. 

I appreciate there was lobster meat falling out of my sandwich but seriously, the lobster roll is the size of a iPhone. I finished the lobster roll in 3-4 bites and wasn't satisfied at all.  I really didn't taste any mayo but did taste the butter on the lobster. Definitely skipping the lobster truck next time I go to a OTG.
author: Jocelyn T.

description:
$14 for a lobster roll?? You be the judge whether that's worth it. My friend and I decided to give Lobsta Truck a try since we've always been eying it ever since we first checked out OTG. Pricing aside, you really get a small piece of bread that's stuffed with lobster claw meat.

Now, the lobster is indeed delicious. Add the butter and the crunchy roll and you're in heaven. However, you can easily gulf down $14 in two bites. This aint sushi where it seems like eating $14 in a bit is like heaven. It's lobster... and though I love lobster, I don't think it's worth paying that much. Not when you can get it at restaurants.

However, it's worth a try so I recommend you check it out!
author: Bryan W.

description:
Lobsta Truck is now serving the San Francisco Bay Area! I feel silly having been the first one in line when they made their debut at the Off the Grid: 5th and Minna for lunch. 

Their schedule is posted on the website. 

If I would return I would go for the non traditional mayo lobsta roll only because I was not a fan of the low quality tasting butter which kind of ruined it for me. While the prices are actually cheaper than a standard lobster roll (~$22) I was not a fan of the quality of the bread (light and airy like cheap grocery store bread) or the butter/margarine mix.
author: Jess C.

description:
I had 2 tacos before eating here, so wasn't that hungry and I was lucky it was so small.

Went to find them last Fri 4/11/14 at 5th & Minna in SOMA where Off the Grid was for lunch.

I asked about the Lobsta Roll to get it with Butter or Mayo and the cashier said for first timers she recommends the Butter so I got that $14.

It took about 10 minutes or more to get my food.  It was a small roll nicely toasted & buttered.  Lots of lobster meat in that roll though.  I enjoyed it, but if you didn't eat 2 tacos beforehand maybe get something else too like clam chowder (cup $5/ pint $8).

I charged it.

www.lobstatruck.com
Follow them on Twitter & FB
info@lobstatruck.com
author: Ann L.

description:
2.5 STARS

The Lobsta truck was having a Fort Mason special. A lobsta roe roll. I love roe so I thought why not?! Plus it was their last one so it was meant to be right?!

I was disappointed in the roll. It had a nice egginess to it but since they didn't do much except put roe on a bread roll, it was just eggy and dry. I wish they would have used a spread or mayo at least.

I'll probably try a normal lobster roll next time I see the Lobsta truck, but the roe roll was a huge miss for me!
author: Elena N.

description: The lobsta roll is very tasty, but $14 for two bites is a bit pricey.  Their clam chowder is very good and reasonably priced.  I will go back again, after I get a 2nd job and save up some money.
author: Jin C.

description: Very meh and very small portions as everyone keeps saying. If someone in your group says hey we should get seafood - remind them this from a food truck and you should get seafood elsewhere. Not sure how this truck is still trucking along with other Off The Grid frontrunners with such low reviews.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I am a huge fan of lobster so whenever I see lobster roll, I always want to try it.  I always like getting it with butter vs. mayonnaise so that the lobster flavor can shine through and at $14, it is decently priced for lobster rolls which are usually $18+.  It is on the light side (literally as the wind blew it across the table) which is great if you want to try another truck but not so great if you're on a budget.  

In comparison to other lobster rolls like Woodhouse that I have tried, it's nothing memorable but as long as they do not increase the price, I would get it again.
author: Joyce Z.

description:
Got the lobster roll with extra meat for $20

Pros:
- Lobster meat was very good, good quality, and cooked right!
- Simple
- Tastes and smells like the ocean! Lol

Cons:
- Small
- Pricey for a food truck food 

Overall:
We bought 1 lobster roll with extra meat and fell in love so we eventually bought another one. I guess people are complaining because it's expensive, but you are getting ALOT of lobster meat. I bought one lobster roll at the fishermen's wharf before for $20 and it was crap with hard bread and hardly any lobster (they trick you!) so this place definitely gives you what you pay for. It's seafood people... You can't expect them to give you that for like $5 lol
author: Vonnie T.

description:
I was disappointed at the lobster roll I ordered. I had the expectation that it would look like the lobster rolls in the East Coast, but to my surprise, the lobster roll was a lot smaller than I thought.

The lobster roll was very simple--buttered lobster and grilled slice of bread.  With it being $14.00, I really wish they didn't use a grilled regular slice of bread that you use to make your sandwiches.  I would rather have them cut a baguette into fourths and use that instead!  The lobster was nothing special and the portion was SO SMALL that I was still starving afterwards.  I really wished it had more intricacy so I could at least feel like I'm getting my money's worth. As a result, I ended up buying some pork belly fries from another food truck at OTG, which was $7.00 and I was way happier purchasing that than the lobster roll.

edit: Also, I just checked my credit card statement and it said they charged me $16.00 instead of $14.00!!!!! I called the credit card company to modify the $2.00 difference.
author: Iris C.

description: Paid $14 for basically a hot dog bun filled with some lobster. Total rip off. They advertise that they sell Maine root soda and when I asked the girl for a certain flavor she just stared at me. I had to repeat it and she awkwardly replied "uh, whatever we have down there" and motioned to something that looked like it should have been a cooler filled with sodas. There was no ice and there were just a handful of cans in there that were beat up and dirty looking. I gave one extra star because the lobster was tasty sure, but the value was shit. Will never ever get food from this truck again. I would actually walk up to people that are about to order and stop them from wasting their money
author: Sarah W.

description:
This is my first review, but this place warranted comment.  The lobster and crab rolls were minuscule, the taste meh and the experience forgettable!  We were the first in line and they had no mayonnaise!  This was definitely not worth the price! 
signed,
Desperately Disappointed from Walnut Creek
author: Kimberly K.

description:
We had a work event and Lobsta Truck was one of the food trucks present. It had the longest line and the longest wait. I waited over 30 minutes to get my lobster roll with butter. It was good, but eating lobster rolls in Boston is much better. The lobster roll was small, and the size of a hot dog bun. I realize that lobster is expensive, but I would not pay $14 for it. 

Next time I would consider the crab roll.
author: Jackie S.

description: had this recently service was good, food didn't take too long and the price for the Lobster roll is about industry average in the bay area $14 and maybe even cheap considering it's in SF. As other have mentioned it's not a huge sandwich so it can be an expensive habit but these rolls were pretty tasty and I enjoy that they are an option in the city.
author: Rod M.

description:
Normally I try not to write bad reviews unless it's absolutely warranted. All I have to say is the cook is quite a horrible person!

My wife and I ate at this truck at the off the grid in pleasant hill about 2 weeks ago and the food was actually quite good.  The problem however is the lady who waited on us was new, but very pleasant and friendly. She ended up messing up our order which is still totally okay, but the owner/cook turned and friggen yelled at her!! It was sufficiently bad that when she turned back to us there was tears in her eyes while she had to finish helping us. 

Anyone who treats their employees that way is definitely NOT going to get my business again.
author: George A.

description:
The lobster in the roll tasted "off." Not spoiled, just very bitter and astringent. Maybe old (or frozen) lobster? A long way from the great taste of fresh lobster.  It's also a tiny roll for $14.

The clam chowder was very heavy and lacked flavor. It''s about the quality you'd expect from a chain restaurant.

Prices would be fair if the quality was better, but they charge way too much for the mediocre food they're serving up.  

Bottom line: Pass it by.
author: B D.

description:
Yesterday was my first SF food truck experience. I spent $23 for the lobster roll (not including tip) a Diet Coke, and chips. I paid $6 for extra meat. 

Was it worth it?

YAAASSS!

Every cent. The plump, buttery chunks of meat left me forlorn after the last bite was finished. Now I find myself fantasizing about the next sandwich. It's a good thing that I live an hour away. My recommendation: buy two of them so that you are not filled with regret.
author: Annette D.

description:
2 stars only because I like the concept; but pretty much stops there. Tried the 'Dungeness' crab with butter and portion was way too small for a $13 sandwich...totally unseasoned crab, cheap bread, cheap butter, and not even a lemon wedge (?). 

Thankfully there was no line, as our 1 order took over 7 minutes to produce...what's going on here guys?

We will not try the Lobsta Truck again.
author: Alan R.

description:
Shell in the lobster rolls, they dont serve their food in order of purchase.

Worst lobster truck out there. Overpriced lobster shell sandwiches are all they serve.

Just spent $55 at off the grid el cerrito, including a $10 tip. They left A TON of shells in my lobster roll, and they served food to the 4 people that ordered after me.

DO NOT GO HERE. DO NOT GO HERE.
author: A S.

description: Food is great if not large. I am worried though about the practice of the guy counting my change and not washing his hands in front of me but repeatedly touching my food tepeatedl
author: John R.

description:
Perfect lunch - price/food quality/portion is on par for the type of food they serve...c'mon folks, seafood is expensive...more than enough meat.  Clam chowder and Lobster bisque were both good - could use a little bit of meat but still delicious.  

I like the simple no nonsense menu.  Glad to see a different food truck in FiDi.  

Definitely a fan and will go again.
author: Grace D.

description:
I was on my way over to Split Bread on Mission and saw the Lobsta Truck parked nearby. There was no line which should have given me a hint. I walked passed the Senior Sisig truck and you would think it was a ride for Disneyland nearby...

I ordered the $13 Crab Roll which was given to me within a minute.

The first thing I noticed is that it felt small, which it was.

Overall, the toast had a nice buttery taste to it, but it didn't have any crunch. So it must have been sitting there. The crab tasted fresh, didn't have a fishy smell and I was pleased that there were no crunch shell parts.

So if this was a $8 dollar sandwich it would be great, but definitely not worth $13 since the portion was small and the bread would have been freshly toasted.

Next time trust I'll trust my instincts when there's no line (or look at Yelp first).
author: Gary C.

description:
OMG!!! They have Maine Root soda!! I've been looking everywhere for the Mandarin  Orange Maine Root soda and Lobsta Truck sells them!! 

Their Lobsta Roll is good but it's so damn expensive!!!
author: Alice X.

description:
What's not to like?  If you get there early and beat the long line, you're going to enjoy some buttery, lobster goodness.  For $12, it isn't cheap, but the lobster roll came with a generous helping of lobster that was fresh, tender, and cooked just enough to still have some snap to it (not mushy and overcooked).  It was probably about a lobster tail's worth of lobster, so for $12 it isn't a rip off.

We got lucky and there was a mini food truck gathering a few blocks from our house.  I made sure to get there right when it started.  By the time I ordered and got my lobster roll, there was already 15-20 people in line.  

These guys should open up a restaurant somewhere.  Near the LB Aquarium would be perfect.  While the food truck thing is fun, sometimes it's nice to not stand in line and to enjoy your food while sitting at a table!
author: Fernando A.

description:
Heard good things from coworkers about this truck so I decided to try it out.  I wasn't too hungry and only ordered the lobster roll with butter which cost $14.  It only took 30 seconds to cook it up and then I was handed my roll.  Dang, this lobster roll was sooo tiny!  I'm petite but this definitely wasn't enough for my lunch.

Besides the small size of the roll, the lobster was pretty good but I really liked how buttery the bread was with the lobster.  It's a single slice of bread but it was toasty warm, soft and a bit crunchy.  I'm glad I finally got to try this truck that my coworkers keep talking about but I had to take off one star for the pricing and another star for the small quantity you get.
author: Sam T.

description:
We tried the Lobsta Truck at Off the Grid - North Berkeley (Sunday Nights). It's new to the Nor Cal food truck scene and probably the most expensive truck at OTG, but my goodness, those rolls were divine! I tried the crab roll with light mayo (you can choose butter or mayo for the rolls; they're mixed to order). My date had the lobster roll with butter. I actually thought the crab was more flavorful, and the bread they use is perfectly soft, lightly buttered and toasted. I could have eaten two, easily.

The lobster bisque was way too creamy, and not flavorful enough for my taste. Kind of like eating heavy cream with a hint of seafood flavor. So lesson learned, splurge on the rolls and you'll be very happy!
author: Nique F.

description: While it was a decent tasting lobster roll $14 to pay for what is essentially an appetizer is a little disappointing... They could at least have a decent size roll to go with your lobster, it was the size of a half of a piece of bread, it reminded me of when I was a child and used to make sandwiches on one piece of bread and fold it in half... Taste was good, but the price was too much...
author: Nicholas G.

description: Oh, Yummy!  I have been waiting to visit this truck since I first learned about it.  I had the lobster roll with extra meat and butter.  A little pricey for lunch, but I expected to pay and it was delicious!  The bread was soft and grilled perfectly.  The lobster was all big chunks of claw meat and had just the perfect amount of melted butter.  Can't wait to try the chowda and crab roll--these are next!  I also love that the website shows locations around the Bay Area--I can easily find a truck and eat there at least once a week.
author: Patty R.

description:
At the OTG: Pleasant Hill, Lobsta Truck caught our eye and we decided that their lobster roll will be one of the foods we will sample. 

It was delicious! The lobster meat was cooked properly and not at all rubbery like some lobster we have had before. We are definitely fans, but I don't think I can say that we will order from them every single time. Even though it is lobster and they do not skimp on the meat, at $14 for a sandwich that is on the smaller side, it is quite a luxury. The cup of clam chowder is $5. It has good flavor but a little watery for our liking, so we probably will not try it again.

If you have a hankering for some lobster, Lobsta Truck is worth the place to do so. 3.5 stars but because it is on the pricey side, I cannot round them up to 4.
author: Clarice O.

description: I went recently as I was on a bisque kick. A small cup is $7 and has decent lobster flavor. The meat is really finely shredded in so there's no satisfaction of getting a chunk like in their roll. I think for twice the amount just plunk down for the roll and get the real satisfaction!
author: Kim N.

description:
I ordered a lobster roll. It was $14. The roll was a folded over slice of bread. The filling was just lobster and butter. Not worth it for the price. The only reason I gave 2 stars is cause the lobster itself was tasty. 

I could make 3 lobster rolls at home for this price and they would be much better tasting and bigger.
author: Brian B.

description:
Oh sweet lobster that was good!  General consensus seams to be that the Lobsta Roll is delicious, but grossly overpriced.  I couldn't agree more.

It's an East Coast staple.  They take a buttered and toasted slice of white bread, fold it in half, and stuff it with huge chunks of lobster covered in butter (or mayo if you prefer).  It's really good, but it's almost comically small.  The whole thing takes 4 or 5 bites to finish max.  While they do give you a decent amount of lobster, at $12 a pop I don't think I would get it again.

The lobster roll would have left me still starving had I not also ordered their clam chowder which was also pretty good.  It was creamy and great flavor, but could have benefited from more clams.  But like the lobster, it was expensive.  A cup will set you back $4, while a pint costs $7.

There's something to be said about spending nearly $20 at a food truck for a meal that doesn't even fill you.  But still, the food was quite tasty and there just aren't too many places around that serve lobster rolls.

Note: This is the same truck as the one in LA.  They just make stops in both counties.
author: Peter P.

description:
I'm going to say 3.75 stars or so? definitely will eat it again because there really are no places to get a lobster roll....it's weird going to a fancy sit down restaurant asking for a lobster roll to go on my lunch break.

I craved and I craved for a good lobster roll ever since my east coast trip and this truck was going to be my saving grace, but I was let down by my high expectations. If you like lobster, but have never had a good lobster roll, you will like this, it's not bad. but don't you EVER say this is like the ones you've had in Maine or Boston. this does NOT compare to that. Like I said it's not bad. You have to try these things if you've never had one, $12 is actually cheap compare to the restaurants that serve these. But when you've had as many as I've had in the past. this is like Burger King....just a little better than McDonald's...but nothing to brag about.

The lobster was fresh, need a bit more salt/flavor, the roll was TOO buttery, when I bit into it, oil DRIPPED out. I think if they add a bit more salt and made it a tad bigger I would've felt better paying $12 for one sandwich at a food truck,  $9 would've been more reasonable for "gourmet" kitchen on wheels. I put up a picture of the roll along with a $5 bill for size reference, take out a bill, the sandwich is smaller than that, and mostly bread anyway.

Check out my review of Lobster Me at Planet Hollywood/Miracle Mile in Las Vegas, NV. THAT place had much better rolls than this...but it's $17. given that they are in the middle of the dessert I can live with that, after all, I can lose $20 at the table in less than a minute anyway.

Here's a list of LA places that have decent (some of them) rolls http://laist.com/2010/07/22/lobster_rolls.php#photo-1
author: Mike N.

description: When i seen the truck I was excited. There was no One waiting. That should have made me walk away.  For the price of the roll I expected a bigger sandwich. It fit in the palm of my hand. It was big enough to feed my two year old niece.  The taste was bland. Customer service was horrible. I will never eat here again and neither will my friends. Boooo!
author: Latritaha R.

description:
I happened to be in Alameda last Sunday so I took BART to North Berkeley for Off the Grid specifically to eat at Lobsta Truck.  It was well worth the trip.

Lots and lots of tasty lobster.  I didn't mind the thin bun because I came to eat lobster, not bread.

I'll be going back to try the version with mayo and then the crab roll.
author: David B.

description: Had your Lobster Roll at Dreamforce! It was so good I thought I'd try it again so I walked in rain to go get it... and the truck wasn't there! I waste my whole lunch break! And I'm still hungry #buzzkill #hangery
author: Latashia G.

description: Wasn't there when I went! Extremely frustrating especially when I had looked forward to this!
author: Trevor A.

description:
ZERO STARS!

Got a cup of lobster bisque with extra meat for $10 ($7 for soup, $3 for meat).

Very disappointed because:

1) the cup is super tiny
2) the bisque is super watery - taste like they used 1 tablespoon of soup and diluted it down with 3/4 water
3) There is NO LOBSTER OR CRAB MEAT
4) Basically just threw $10 away for a tiny cup of flavored warm water.

I didn't even bother trying the lobster roll because they were the size of my fist for $14! (And I have tiny hands)!

Sorry Lobsta truck. You lotsa suck. Goodbye forever.
author: I-Ching L.

description:
Ahh the infamous Lobsta roll.  

For $12 it's much smaller than I expected or that you see in these pic.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/8y3O9KJmofweGxvAclw2tQ?select=vyNWGiUrCCGO7VT0YufWQw.  Good size chuncks of lobster is stuffed in a toasted buttery roll.  The lobster itself didnt have a lot of butter on it but was good.  I didnt order anything else from the truck so I was still a tad bit hungry.  Next time I will try the crab roll and maybe a soup.

It was crustacean from a truck yummy goodness!
author: Lica N.

description:
Lobster Truck has a limited menu:
-lobster roll
-crab roll
-clam chowder
-lobster bisque

locale: OTG: lake merritt(3/21)
eats: lobster roll(14) w/butter
-small roll (little bigger than a dinner roll)
-overflowing with lobster chucks (about 4) in a tiny roll
-butter faintly tasted, lobster flavor just as faint
not sure if sourced from fresh lobster
-came out within minutes.

leftovers:
-not really a fan of lobster
usually like lobster only as lobster yee mein (fried noodles, cantonese style)
-value 2 stars.
-chips, drinks sourced from cape cod area. nice touch.
author: Victor G.

description:
After having tried the lobster roll from Doyle's Cafe in Boston, I've been craving for a delicious lobster roll in CA. When I found out about Lobsta Truck, I got so excited and decided to visit one of their trucks right away. Luckily, one of their trucks is part of Alameda Off The Grid. 

When I got there, around 2p, the line was really long and they're out of their lobster bisque. After waiting in line for around 15 minutes, it was finally my turn. I ordered 2 lobster rolls, one with mayo and one with butter. I waited for another 10 minutes for my food and finally....

I was so disappointed when I opened my bag, they're so tiny! Yes they are filled with lobster, but the lobster was really chewy. It's probably the fat of the lobster. There's also absolutely no flavor in them! It's basically just lobster fat and bread. With the price that they charge for, it's totally not worth it. Not even to satisfy a craving!

I guess my mission of finding a good lobster roll in CA will continue.
author: Cathy B.

description:
I ventured to Off the Grid Fort Mason tonight. Not too hungry but more than curious as to what they had at the event.

One new truck that I spotted was Lobsta Truck. Gotta try it.
The line was not huge (compared to other trucks) so I hunkered down for the wait and contemplated the offerings.
Lobster roll. Check. 
Crab roll. Check. 
Clam Chowder. Check. 
Lobster Chowder. Check. 
Cape Cod Chips. Check.
Whoopie Pie (?)

It was cold. I needed something hot. Got the clam chowder cup $5. It was not a very big cup but I know why. It's R-E-A-L-L-Y rich soup. The soup musta been thickened with heavy cream and pureed potatoes. There were big pieces of clams and bacon which you could taste with each mouthful. Delicious but not low-cal food.
author: Joanna T.

description: Yum!  I've had the lobster sandwich with butter twice now at the Off the Grid Fort Mason and the 5th and Minna OtG location.  So good with the lightly toasted bun, chunks of lobster dripping with melted butter!  I noticed they had a crab sandwich last time as well.  I need to try that next time!  I didn't post a picture of my lobster sandwich as I am sure there are already tons of them posted anyway.  Can't wait to see you again, Lobsta Truck!
author: Maile N.

description:
OTG Oakland/Lake Merritt
Friday pm

Excited to see Lobsta Truck was going to be at the event, so dragged hubby and my teenage son there for dinner.

Limited menu:  Lobster Roll.  Crab Roll.  Clam Chowder.  Lobster Bisque (I think that was it)

Ordered 2 lobster rolls and cup of lobster bisque.
I kid you not.  My 13 yr old inhaled the sandwich in 2 mins.
It was on the small side, a bit pricey IMO
There were chunks of lobster on the roll - which is prob the size of 2 King Hawaiian rolls put together.
Bisque was flavorful.
Not sure if I'll go back since there are other better lobster roll joints in the Bay Area.
author: Margaret W.

description:
I finally hunted down the Lobsta Truck at Off The Grid in Berkeley - well, I persuaded my husband to hunt it down. I'd  love to give it more than 3 stars. Portion size was the cincher - the only one.

I had the lobster roll.  It was divine.  You can have your lobster with buttery goodness or mayo.  I am not a mayo person. 

The bread looked like Texas Toast - lightly grilled and buttery.  However it was softer and there appeared to be only one slice.

My sandwich was heavenly - just small.  Given lobster is the main ingredient the price is justified.  However,  I recommend you not come hungry.  Eat a salad first or between meals.


Service was quick and courteous. Bring your tastebuds, not your appetite.
author: Joanna B.

description:
Let's face it, we are a long way from New England, and lobster is expensive here. The food truck is certainly more expensive than other food trucks, and more expensive than Sam's Chowdermobile.

However, the lobster and lobster chowder were very high quality (better than the last lobster roll I had at Sam's which tasted rubbery and stale). The sandwich (which I wished could have been larger) had large chunks of very fresh tasting, sweet lobster. The claim chowder had a rich taste and there were chunks of lobster in the soup (even without ordering extra meat).
author: Matt R.

description:
DELICIOUS.  I always get the crab with extra meat.  The crab is fresh, not frozen; you can taste it.  Big chunks, lightly seasoned, perfect with the bread they use.
Yes, it seems kinda "small" relative to today's US super-size portions, but honestly it's more than enough.  They pack it with meat, and then cover it in butter.  When I'm feeling particularly gluttonous, I get two sandwiches. But that usually puts me over the edge.  And I eat a LOT.   I certainly don't mind the cost because they do the work and hand me the perfect snack.  I also don't always get to splurge on this, so when I can, I don't hesitate or skimp!
Thanks, Lobsta Truck!  You guys make me smile!
author: Steph C.

description:
I was pretty excited to see this truck sitting outside our building on Pine street.

Then I got even more excited when at 12 o'clock on a Friday, there was only 1 person in line!

But I should have gotten the hint....

First and foremost, the size vs price ratio is wayyyyyy outta whack. Our sandwich was ridiculously tiny and 14.00....don't add extra meat else you are looking at a 20.00 for about 5 bites.

Now maybe it was my fault for getting a crab sandwich at a lobsta truck but seriously, it tasted like oily bread with no flavor.

Overall, glad I tried it but I will not be returning.
author: Andrea P.

description: What a let-down. 14 dollars for the tiniest lobster roll I've ever had. You can finish that thing in about three bites. I also ordered a cup of clam chowder, which was really gritty and bland.
author: Zach B.

description:
Boooo... what a disappointment.  

I got the opportunity to try this little food truck at the huntington beach food truck festival.  We ordered the crab roll which was $11.  They asked us if we wanted mayo or butter.  We told them we wanted both.  Well that was exactly what we got.  The crab roll was basically a slice of bread rolled like a taco with stuffed crab meat mixed with butter and mayo.  Waste of money.  The crab tasted like its been from a can.  Definitely not fresh.  The only up side to this place is their delicious $2 lemonade.  Was so good we came back for another one.
author: Cat N.

description:
I tried the Lobsta Truck for the first time earlier this summer at the Munchathon event in Irvine. I had been dying to try it ever since I read about it's entry into the food truck scene in the OC Register. I was so sad when I saw the huge line for it at the event, but I was determined to try it so I waited patiently until I could order.

They have two main items that they serve on their menu - the "lobsta" roll and the crab roll. They have a few other items such as clam chowder, desserts and drinks as well, but my eyes were on the lobsta roll. The lobsta roll is fresh lobsta meat on a toasted split top roll and you can get it with either mayo or butter. For $12, I thought it would be bigger so I was a little disappointed to see that it wasn't that big (hehehe, I can't help myself - *insert "that's what she said" joke). Nonetheless, the lobsta roll tasted bombbb. The bread was toasted just right and the lobsta meat wasn't drenched in butter, just enough to give it the additional flavor.

Service was excellent. The guys in the truck were super nice. I guess one of them heard it was another customer's birthday so when he called up her order, he also gave her a whoopie pie for free as a birthday gift. Overall, yes, the food here is really good, but for the price, it's sorta meh, since the one roll won't fill you up and you'll leave still hungry. Still, it definitely doesn't hurt to try it.
author: Elise V.

description: Incredibly delicious lobster and heavily buttered roll.  Loved it.  But it was so small.  I probably could've eaten another one and still not be full.  I'm glad I tried it but don't think I'll stop by the truck again.  Too expensive for what you get.
author: .Hon H.

description: So I got the $5 cup of clam chowder. I love the taste of freshness ..felt like you're eating a healthy soup. the only downside is that I only found one potato in my small soup I wish it was more chunky but oh well. I love clam chowder period if I could I would eat it all day everyday .. The price I understand that's just most of the food trucks.
author: Myrna R.

description:
Yeah, this place wasn't a homerun. Last week at Off the Grid Daly City I saw people with awesome looking lobster rolls, and I thought that they were from here (but maybe not). So this week when there wasn't a long line, I decided to check it out.

Honestly, it was just a bit bland. I make lobster rolls myself, imitating the recipe used at Son of a Gun in Los Angeles (AWESOME)... and there's just more of every flavor. More lemony. More sriracha-ey. More garlicky.

Lacking in flavor, kind of on the small side, and really pricey. Yeah, not impressed.
author: Sean B.

description:
First saw this truck at OTG: Millbrae's soft opening but there were too many trucks I wanted to try, this one didn't make the cut. Saw them at OTG: Serramonte so I had to try them this time around.

My Order:
Lobster Roll: ($14) w/butter

I'm not a fan of mayo so I opted for the butter sauce. Honestly, it wasn't that memorable. The lobster pieces were nice and juicy and the sauce was barely noticeable. This was fine since I could taste the lobster better, but for the price, I'd rather go to New England Lobster Market as you get more value (and food) and a better roll.
author: Kitty K.

description:
Wish I could check in at a truck but apparently yelp thinks I'm too far away from it .

The lobsta truck serves lobsta rolls and they are good. 

It's been weeks since I've been here and I think about them all the time so I might upgrade this review to a 4.
author: C D.

description: Yum, yum, yum! Lobsta Truck was at Dreamworks for a party serving up their delicious lobster rolls. They were so good! Everyone kept going back for more! The bread was nice, thick and slightly toasted. The lobster was fresh and delicious and covered in yummy butter! I really enjoyed it.
author: Kari G.

description:
Terrible value for such a high price. My lobster roll was 14$, and was quite literally 5 small cubes of lobster, on a lightly toasted roll that was probably four inches long. I would say it was moderately tasty, but nothing that knocked me on my ass. 

I don't know what else to say, as that was all I ordered.
author: Chris S.

description: I thought this was really mediocre. The bread was dry but the lobster was dry and lacked flavor even with the butter. For 14 bucks i don't see how this would be a must have. I think if there was a way to create more flavor with and fix the issue with the dryness I'd come back. It did taste fresh and I love lobster but I think perhaps on this one day it missed the mark.
author: Derek S.

description: Lobsta truck would be the ideal place if you're craving for a quick and clean lobster meal. The price was overly expensive, $14 dollars for a very very small lobster roll with tiny lobster bits. Unfortunately, the price just did not match the amount of food and lobster pieces on the roll.
author: Ka Yan C.

description: Complete rip off for the price. Cashier Ask if you want extra meat and doesn't tell you the price. For six dollars the meat looked the same as it would with nothing extra. The butter made my stomach hurt.
author: Josephine C.

description:
Lobster Roll with butter
- about 4 bites worth for $14. is it good? yes. is it worth it? meh not really.  i enjoyed the buttery bread more than the rubbery lobster meat

the wait is long even if the line is short, don't be fooled, hands are moving slow in here.  i giggled as i saw one of the guys in the truck open a bag of bread and stare off into the distance for a good minute.

P.S.: make sure to check your change if you pay cash and your order before you leave, during my 5 person wait in line for ordering/picking up there were 2 people who were either not given change or the wrong change and had to ask for their change back, also there were 2 orders that had been messed up (lacking extra meat)
author: Tina A.

description:
Did I forget to mention I love the food truck round up on Wednesdays off Teller and Michelson?

The lobsta truck line was amazingly short when my friend and I decided on frequenting their truck for lunch yesterday.  The truck had a good selection of different kinds of rolls so I opted for the lobster roll with mayo and she got the one with butter.  Yes, the prices are slightly steep but do you actually eat lobster every day? And for lobster this fresh, it is definitely worth it.

The roll was a wonderful concoction of mayo, the freshest lobster roughly chopped in a delicious roll that was lightly toasted with butter on the outside.  I loved the lobster, don't get me wrong, but the roll was what did it for my friend and I.

The service was super quick as well (which is always a plus) and super friendly.  I only had the roll and a diet coke for lunch, and I was pretty full.

If you go to the food truck round up, go after 12 and closer to 1PM, it helps avoid the lines and you will be able to find a seat where you can enjoy your tasty meal.
author: Kelly M.

description: Let me start by making fun of all the morons crying about how expensive and small the lobster rolls are at this food truck. Do your fucking homework rookies. I don't know if you yelpers are getting lobster rolls off the lobster black market for less than $10 bucks but fyi lobster rolls aren't cheap and they are not  supposed to be served on colossal buns. And for those complaining of the crappy bun....ask to have it extra toasted, problem solved. Would I go back to this truck, hell ya. Next time I'm gonna ask for extra butter. Friendly cashier, fast service, main root soda (only found this in Brooklyn)! Fin! If you like this place definitely check out Red Hook in Brooklyn, it will blow your mind. But wait for it, the lobster roll at the Red Hook are in the realm of $20 bucks per roll, that includes tax (lobster is straight from Maine). Now complain rookies!
author: Nick L.

description: I've tried their lobster roll with extra meat twice at the Foster City Off-The-Grid event. Both times the lobster smelled fishy and tasted off. In contrast, the lobster from Sam's Chowder I had this past week did not have the fishy smell.
author: Wilson C.

description:
I tried the Lobsta Truck in Novato. 

I wanted to hate this small $14 (yikes!) sandwich, the size of a regular Hot Dog Bun, filled but not overstuffed. 

But I have to say- it had plenty of lobster meat in it- including a nice mixture of claw and tail. Just because you CAN eat the whole thing in 5-6 bites doesn't mean you really SHOULD eat more lobster than that. 

I consider lobster kind of a special summer luxury. And, lobster IS very rich.

I had mine on decent grilled roll- similar to a hot dog bun (but maybe it has been trimmed prior to grilling?) which was hot and fresh. Grilled with care. I chose drawn butter (rather than mayo- the alternative that was offered)

I think I would like just a spritz of lemon and a sprinkling of chives or scallions, to balance the delicious flavor. Maybe that's just me?

That being said- the lobster I ate at this  truck was sweet, fresh-tasting, perfect texture- and superior to some lobster  I've eaten in some expensive restaurants. How can that be? This guy must know what he's doing. So much can go wrong with this delicate shellfish...

Lobster- It's a special treat. 

Please, Lobsta Man, consider charging $12 for this sandwich, be reasonable. It's just not quite large enough to be $14. 

And it doesn't need to be larger.! It just needs to be $12.

And keep up the good work!
author: Susan B.

description: Small sandwich for 14 bucks.  They tried to upsell me on extra meat for another 6 bucks.  Actually the amount of meat was adequate.  Lobster was fairly fresh, but totally naked.  It needed mayo or a bit of butter.  I probably won't return.
author: Max K.

description:
the first time i tried this truck was at the OTG in the Marina on my birthday the first Friday of October. I know that lobster is expensive so i sucked it up didnt let the $14 price scare me away. 

i ordered the Lobster Roll with butter and my cousin ordered the Lobster Roll with mayo and EXTRA lobster. by the time we arrived to the next food truck, we had both finished our sandwiches. paying an extra $6 for "extra" meat i feel personally wasnt worth it. my cousins lobster had maybe 3 or 4 extra claw pieces than mines. plus she said the mayo sorta threw off the taste on the sandwich (she said she'll definitely get butter next time).

i went back when they were on 5th and Townsend a week later and ordered the 2 Lobster Rolls with butter (1 for lunch and for dinner). the guy who took my order looked really annoyed that he was working at the truck. as soon as i unwrapped my food, i was surprised at how much less meat was in there than the first time i went (in the Marina). i wasnt expecting the roll to be overflowing with meat but it didnt even reach the top of the bread. i just went again yesterday and same thing, the meat was even that much more less than the second time  (young slim guy who took my order was actually talking and super cheerful. this was at Serramonte 10/28/14)

i wish they would be consistent with the amount of meat they put every single time. one thing i could say is the bread they use is pretty good!!

i dont think i'll be going out of my way to find this truck unless i just so happen to walk/drive by it 

1.5 stars for the bread
half star for the lobster
2 stars for the really nice guy
author: Leilah M.

description:
Claw Meat only. Small portion to price. Dried out or rubbery. Watered Bisque.

This was not fresh Maine lobster as the truck states and maybe I'm being harsh, but growing up in New England and having an uncle who was in the lobster business, putting "Fresh Maine Lobster" on your menu is a risky move. 

The Lobster Bisque was of water consistency with ZERO meat, not even shredded meat bits.
author: Brian J.

description: I ordered a lobster bisque for 7 dollars and all I got was a mini 8oz cup. My first impression was this cant be my order. My second impression was i just got conned. The soup literally had zero lobster or meat. I just overpaid for flavored water. My last impression was to never ever come back.
author: Babak K.

description: Went to their truck, $14 for a snacksized roll. Bread was toasted, lobster was fine but nothing better than average.
author: Ronald S.

description: It was meh.  Honestly I think they were one or two spoonfuls of butter away from a 5.  The bread was good and they give you A LOT  of lobster.  But what was missing was the buttery taste I was craving for on my lobster.  I ordered one with mayo and the other with butter. If I would suggest anything it would be that they ask customers how they want their lobster roll.  Everyone has a different preference and I would have preferred it with more butter and seasoned mayo.  It also seemed like the food was sitting there pre-made because within a coupe minutes my order was ready.  The roll was somewhat warm and the lobster wasn't warm at all.  I know that with food trucks they require that most of the food be prepared before hand but it doesn't hurt to stick it in a toaster oven for a little.
author: JJ S.

description:
I agree with other yelpers that the lobster roll is impressive but also not cheap. In this case though, you definitely get what you pay for. I've eaten their lobster roll once but I crave it all the time. I found the portion to be satisfactory, I can see why others think it's too small but considering the portion of lobster I received and the richness of the butter, I personally don't think it needs to be any bigger.

Lobsta Truck if you're out there, please hear us. A lower price would make for very happy and loyal customers. For the record, I'd pay $12!
author: Laura C.

description: I ordered a pint of the lobster bisque. When the (super foxy) guys behind the counter realized they were almost out, they charged me only half price and threw in the clam chowder. I'm so glad they did, the chowder was DELICIOUS. Super creamy and bacon-y and distinctively of the Maine style. I'll be back to try the rolls.
author: Kelly M.

description:
it's not cheap, but i enjoyed every bite. it's worth it! i got the lobster roll with butter, clam chowder and the lemonade... the lemonade is nothing special, i just needed something to drink.... 

one lobster roll AND a small cup of clam chowder could be filling enough, at least for me. next time though i'd try the crab one! start following them on fb! yummy lobsters off the truck! i love it.
author: Bonnie Y.

description:
Decent lobster rolls. However, based on other lobster rolls I've gotten off of food trucks, the amount of physical lobster was pretty disappointing. In fact, I would almost recommend the extra lobster addition as mandatory to turn this into a real meal, although that boosts the price of the roll into the stratosphere. 

However, the lobster bisque is what saved my impression of this place, and is extremely good! (However, like some other reviewers state, its hard to find solid lobster in the bisque, so keep that in mind)
author: Oliver Z.

description:
Tried the lobster roll at the soma streat food park. Chunks of fresh, somewhat chewy lobster on a buttered sandwich roll, mayonnaise for me please. $12.99.
The roll was tasty, but dry. The dryness of the roll made it hard to taste the lusciousness of the lobster. I needed lobster lube to rise above the drag of the roll. Some suggested a margarine flavor on the bread and i agree. The lobster itself was delicious, but the concoction was a step down. A moister filling, some green onions and a better roll is my Rx.
The truck also offers crab rolls, chips and moon pies. 
You can find a better lobster roll at prime dip in streat food, or the lobster shack in redwood city.
author: Kelly K.

description:
I wanted to hate this sandwich. 
FOURTEEN DOLLARS! 

But it's delicious. 
And expensive.
author: Mimi S.

description:
LOBSTA ROLL

It's just OK.  People just hyped it up and disappointed me big time.  Why do you all have to do this to me?

A friend and I shared, since we were eating other food items from other food trucks.  We got their Lobsta Roll w/ mayo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/8y3O9KJmofweGxvAclw2tQ?select=xI5yKVuX7t_atmKaXlBOZQ

$12 later and about 10 minutes later, the lobsta roll was ready.  When we got it, we looked at each other and said "wow, that's it?".  We split it in half and ate it.  It wasn't really mind blowing but it wasn't that bad, either. It was actually pretty tasty, but I'm not sure if it was well worth the price.  It's really expensive for something small, but it's worth trying once... or twice.
author: Jay Y.

description: Really tasty crab roll with butter. Just a little expensive for a very small sandwich, $13. Should have had more meat.
author: B K.

description: Tasty lobster rolls but the size would suit Mighty Mouse ...maybe. The lobster was very fresh and "naked" as a true lobster roll should be... Just butter and the traditional buttered bun was the case... And if it were more than three bites I'd spend the $$ again for another... One and done. Think it was $14
author: Carlos G.

description:
My wife loves crab and she loves crab rolls. Saw this truck tonight at Off the Grid Haight and decided to take a  gamble and bring one home for her (a good crab roll off a food truck? No way).

Wow. The thing was delicious. And for $13? Amazing flavor and and a shitload of crab. I'll have a real hard time NOT picking one up next time I see these guys. Mad props Lobsta Truck!!!
author: Food D.

description:
OTG - San Francisco, Tribune Building, Friday the 11th

Menu was sparse but what else do you need? I had the crab roll (with extra crab), buttered, with chips and a ginger soda. Everything was top-notch. The roll with extra was pricey, but well worth it. Excellent!
author: Hans S.

description:
Lobsta Truck knows what people want and they deliver.  They serve nothing but Lobster and Crab Rolls, prepacked potato chips, and drinks.  Nothing more, nothing less.  

I opted for the Lobster Roll, since that is what the truck is named after.  For $12, you get a 6" split-top roll that has been gratuitously buttered and grilled.  I opted to have my lobster dressed with butter instead of mayo because I wanted the clean taste of the lobster to come through.  Each bite was to be savored.  It was nothing but butter, firm meat, and crispy bread.  Admittedly, there is a lot of butter in this dish so if you are shy about that, maybe you should ask for mayo.  Not like that would be less rich.  

A part of me wishes that the truck would expand its offerings and make itself into a seafood shack.  It's hard to treat this truck as a place where you can get a full meal when they serve so little yet at such a high price point.  Can you imagine being served piping hot trays of fat, fried clam strips or a fish and chips with a tartar sauce?
author: Les L.

description:
I see a lot of reviews complaining about the amount of food you get.

Here's my reality:

Today I hadn't eaten anything all day (not even a glass of water) and so this was the first food I ate (at 5pm). I had a lobster roll, extra meat, with butter, and a cup of lobster bisque.
I weigh 235 pounds (on a bad day), I can eat 4 pieces of Costco pizza, or 2 Big Macs plus a 20-piece nuggets in a single sitting, and folks, this was plenty of food (remember, I had an empty stomach going into this, too).
