In fact, as I neared the end of the lobster roll, I thought to myself "even if this thing had a bit less meat, I'd be completely satisfied." And then I realized I still had the bisque. 

So why the discrepancy? Part of it might be that if you've ever had lobster in a restaurant (like the actual animal, steamed in its shell), you realize that there isn't really THAT much meat in a 1.5 pound lobster. It's mostly shell. So I have to say I was impressed when I got the lobster roll that the amount of meat that was there (with the extra meat option) seemed like the majority of what's inside most lobsters. Lobster is dense meat. It's like eating filet mignon. You can't compare the quantity of lobster or filet mignon to the quantity of microwave popcorn you get in a bag. 

The toast was perfectly prepared and the butter was plentiful (and I'm a guy who doesn't scrape off the big scoop of butter they put on the Denny's pancakes). The taste was what made this for me. I did not mind spending $20. I've had less satisfying meals in restaurants where my meal exceeded $20.

The $7 for the cup of bisque? I didn't find that item worth it. It was "ok" but not memorable. There were no bits of lobster (I expected at least something), and the bisque wasn't as creamy as I expect.

It seemed like the wait was longer than it should have been, but I wasn't in any hurry. If I was in a hurry, I probably would have been a bit annoyed.
author: Henry K.

description: Lobsta truck is A-OK and I will be back.  In short- the Lobster Rolls are excellent- I've had them on several occasions and they were always great.  Price is $14 (not cheap) and the portion is relatively small.  So I will recommend Lobsta Truck for their quality of food and as a 'luxury food truck'- but not from the perspective of 'best value' as you will likely be hungry when you finish your lobster roll.  The taste will delight but the portion may underwhelm.  Lobster isn't cheap- I get it- but you need to consider all of these factors when planning out your meal at an OTG event.
author: Andy S.

description: I got the lobster roll with extra meat. Smallest $20 lobster roll I ever did see. It's the size of a Oscar Meyer hot dog. You're going to need to shell out another 10-15 bucks to get a real meal after the roll. So disappointing. You can go to New England lobster company and get a real sized lobster roll with chips for the same price. Taste is whatevers too. Worst purchase today.
author: Joyce S.

description: Way too small.  Put some actual thought into this, no one wants to spend $14 for miniscule portions.  If you can't afford more lobster add a corn salsa, or cheese, anything to make it better.  Use better bread, just don't expect to survive very long selling that portion for $14.
author: Tree P.

description:
Paid the extra $$$ for extra meat on my lobster roll at Off The Grid Fort Mason, frankly a total rip off, and very average quality. 

Fails massively In comparison to some of the other food trucks there. I honestly sat there and wondered what it would have cost in gas money & time to find a "RedLobster" vs the cost of this never-again as I ate it.

The meat was pulpy and over saturated in butter on a cheap-ass bun. $24 I'll never buy again. Honestly felt stupid for falling for this!
author: Steve L.

description:
Yep the reviews are all true. The lobster roll is a mighty small $12 sandwich. But you know what? It's almost worth it. Lots of huge chunks of fresh lobster, drizzled with butter on a soft lightly toasted roll. Very yum and I'm not even a huge fan of these scavengers of the sea. 

The Lobsta (spelled to be pronounced with that very annoying New England accent)Truck was parked in front of the OC Mix, a part of the South Coast Collection maze of shops off the 405 in Costa Mesa. This location was a key part of making this a def hit. Walk your order of choice into the OC Mix building where the always hilarious and sometimes sarcastic Phil will await you at We Olive with vino and beer. He not only recommended the perfect chardonnay to accompany the lobster, he also gave us some garlic olive oil to add on. Wow, thanks Phil! Man did that kick it up several notches. 

They have trucks parked here every Saturday as well as Tues and Thurs, and according to Phil they mix it up with dif trucks each week. We arrived at 11:30 yesterday to 6 or 7 trucks and it was pretty dead. Sweet.

The staff manning the Lobsta Truck are very cool and funny and my roll was handed to me in a mere 5 minutes. No painfully long waits here, not yet anyway. One lobster roll, one bag of Cape Cod chips and one Chard from We Olive = $27 inc tips. As I mentioned to my friends: 27 bucks and I'm not even full or buzzed. 

So yeah, not a casual Saturday lunch that I will be repeating any time soon, but it was fun for a one off. I will return to try some of the other trucks in the near future though.
author: Dan H.

description:
First off ... I'd like to thank the Kogi truck for being parked along the same street. With you and your loyal mass followers ... who flock to every siting ... I was able to stroll up to the Lobsta Truck behind two other eager patrons ... allowing me just enough time to make my order selection for the night.

The menu is simple: Lobster Roll, Crab Roll, Clam Chowder. I was so tempted to get all three ... but i decided "I need other dishes to get me back".  So, this being my virgin run ... I went for the Lobster Roll.

After I ordered ... i waited less than 5 minutes (no, I didn't time it) before they called out my name.  Ahh, my Lobster roll and Fresh Lemonade was ready.  As I reached for my meal from the high window counter and lowered it to eye level ... i noticed my meal getting bigger, but by not much.  Other reviews were not kidding; the stuffed roll was so petite, I could easily eat two, if not three. But at $12 each ... this food truck delight could turn easily into a $40 meal.

As I walked back to my car to enjoy my hand sized roll stuffed with lobster covered with grade aaa butter ... I was guessing how many bites it would take to finish (three? four??).

It took me about 5 -6 bites but i truly lost count because once i took that first bite into the perfectly toasted roll ... my mouth was in heaven.

The Lobster was very fresh, so much that I swear I smelled salt water ... and with the meat so tender, either it was flown in fresh that day ... or they really tenderized it! Either way ... it was divine!

I am a fan for sure, but my wallet says "um, let's wait til next pay day".

If this was at a sit down place where I can enjoy my meal while soaking up some Maine Lobsta culture ... I'd say well worth the price. But coming from a food truck that I trekked over to find and to eat the meal ... either in my car or like other patrons ... standing around in a circle like black crows attacking it's last meal ... I can't get myself to justify the $12 price (knowingly that my stomach aches for more).

Until next time....
author: gene d.

description: fantastic crab and lobster! friendly staff and fresh seafood. Will be returning!
author: Dario L.

description:
I loved the idea of this truck and so far I gotta say it's 50/50.  Been there twice. The first time was in Novato and it was great. The lobster roll is expensive at $14 per roll but it is worth it if it is flavorful.  We tried it again this past weekend at OTG Larkspur and it was not nearly as good...the flavor was just not there. I will be trying it again along with other things but I was severely disappointed this time.

On the other hand the Maine rootbeers are good and they are nice in the truck so thats good. Hopefully the lobster roll tastes like lobster next time :/
author: Cole K.

description: It was good but not really worth it... $14 for a little snack. I need to go buy myself some real lunch now.
author: Megan C.

description:
I've been craving lobster rolls lately so when I saw that the Lobsta truck would be nearby I told my bf we should hit up the food trucks for lunch. I looked them up on Yelp beforehand and it worried me that they had a three-star average rating... But my stomach was growling and fixated on lobster rolls so I threw caution to the wind and ordered a lobster roll with butter.

The roll was the typical lobster roll white bread that was buttered inside. The lobster was plentiful but not sweet. It was also bland - there was no melted butter on the lobster chunks and just the tiniest bit of salt. As other reviewers have mentioned, the sandwich was pretty small for $14. You have the option of adding extra lobster for $6 more, which would be comparable to Old Port Lobster Shack prices.

Kind of a letdown, so I wouldn't recommend.
author: Bella L.

description: Okay. Read the reviews about the size of the sandwich & they are true! I've frequented many trucks & by far this is the most expensive priced item & by far the smallest bang for $14!!! Yes, it is lobster with butter & it was good. However I couldn't call it a sandwich. Literally it was a big slice of bread with lobster meat & butter. It was smaller than the length of the palm of my petite hand. My 6 yo could eat the entire thing & still be hungry. So good is good but way overpriced & portion is skimpiest I've ever seen. So beware!
author: Jules K.

description:
Novelty vs. Quality

So I have bought into the food truck craze: hook, line, and sinker.  But in true foodie fashion, I will jump right off the bandwagon the second the novelty of an experience overshadows the food.  

Yesterday I ventured to a local high school's fundraiser here in Fullerton anticipating a number of food trucks to try with some friends.  The Lobsta Truck was our first stop.  Expecting to order from several different trucks that day, we all hesitated when we saw the prices here.  $12 for the lobster roll and $11 for the crab roll.  But we wanted good lobster and weren't disheartened.  One of our group left to drive around town and find an ATM.  (We found out after he left that they accept credit cards).

We ordered two lobster rolls with butter and one clam chowder (the clam chowder was a reasonable $4).  The food was ready in literally one minute, which was surprising.  The first thing we instantly noticed was the small size of the sandwiches.  Despite how it may look in pictures, it's about the size of a small hotdog.  Not a good first impression to a hungry group intending to share.  

After my first bite, I realized why the sandwich was ready so fast.  It was served cold, which wasn't what I'd been expecting.  I can see how this makes sense from a business standpoint.  It's certainly easier to precook and separate lobster for quick serving later.  All they had to do was grill bread on the spot.  But for lobster, the quality suffers while the price remains high.  I'd rather go to a nice seafood restaurant.  When our friend returned from the ATM, we told him to save his $12 for another truck.  

I reject the idea in other Yelpers' posts of "It's lobster!  Of course it's expensive".  If it were truly amazing lobster, I doubt anybody reviewing here would have an issue with the price.  

**Sidenote:  I didn't get to try the clam chowder, but I'm told it was "pretty good" and not too salty.  If I go to this truck again, I'll be going with that.
author: Jamie R.

description: I just had a lobster role in Larkspur. Cost me $20 as I asked for extra meat. Also asked the mayo instead of butter. When it came it looked small. I wonder what the portion size would have been if I didn't order the extra meat... It was open faced and when I asked for a fork I was told no, they didn't have any and spoons were reserved for soup... There was no taste of mayo to detect... I shared a bit with my son, a couple bites, and I am still really hungry! Spent $20, no fork, no mayo and a really small portion... I'd say total ripoff?!
author: Wim L.

description: For $14, you get a good toast, and a reasonable amount of lobster. It's snack-size, not meal-size. I know it's lobster, but it's really not a lot of food. It was fine, but not worth the money.
author: Max T.

description:
I've been fortunate to have devoured lobster rolls when I lived in the New England area, in Boston, Connecticut, and Rhode Island. Nothing in Maine, however. Obviously, it's a bit unfair to compare to Lobsta Truck, in both price, value, and flavor. But there's at least some type of reference to draw from during my 3 bites of Lobsta Truck's lobsta roll.

After opening up a half hour late to a massive line (I could see one of the workers inside mouthing OMG with bulging eyes once the door opened), orders finally started. Of course, there was drama already. They were handing out food at random order, annoying a lot of people, and I overheard a lady complaining about how small the lobster roll was. The guy at the front snapped at her and said "you can hand it over, we can give your money back." I didn't know we were also supposed to be getting the Boston 'tude to go along with the food!

I fork over $24 in cash for two lobster rolls, one with butter and one with mayo. The food comes out, and my wife and I waste little time in sinking our teeth into these lobster rolls. After trying both the mayo and butter versions, I'd have to give the edge to the butter version. The buttah just enhanced the lobsta meat flavor, while the mayo didn't really bring anything to the table. If anything, it was more bland. It desperately needed more seasoning. 

Yes, the lobster rolls are small. It took me 3 bites to finish one. There could've been a bit more meat -- it's an illusion that the meat is overflowing from the roll, because they don't really fill the bottom part of the roll (so you're getting a little bite of air). The lobster meat itself was tender, and you can actually differentiate between the tail and claw meat by the texture and chewiness of each bite.
 
I'm a huge seafood lover -- lobster, crab, shrimp, you name it -- and I'm not afraid to pay good money for good food. With the long lines, it looks like I'm not the only one. But hey, I get the appeal. It's LOBSTER. But my main gripe is that the lobster roll lacked any soul, if that makes sense. There's no point in trying to replicate an authentic lobster roll, so why not give it a SoCal twist? Perhaps introduce new ingredients, new flavors, bring something new to the game. I don't know, that's just me.
author: Dru C.

description: OTG Burlingame.  Had a lobsta roll with extra lobsta.  If this is the extra lobster, I'd hate to see what the regular roll is like.  $20 is way too much for this.  Not blown away by the quality of the lobster either.  Texture of pre-frozen lobster which has been slightly overcooked and the roll is less than impressive.  Wouldn't go here again.
author: Julia A.

description: Had the lobster roll and it was pretty good as far as taste. I don't care what anyone says, size does matter. The sandwich is roughly the size of one slice of wonder bread split in half, which is ridiculously small for a $14 sandwich unless it has gold in it. I'll save my money and go to Sam's Chowder Mobile in the park. Their rolls are a bit more appropriate in size.
author: M T.

description:
got the chance to try the Lobsta Truck food at Off the Grid @ Evergreen.

we ordered:
Lobsta Roll with extra lobster in butter
Lobsta Bisque

hubby & i loved them both.
Lobsta Roll was very delicious:  moist lobster & nicely toasted bread
Lobsta Bisque was very flavorful

thanks to the guys working the truck that day...we want to say..."the food was Delicious"
author: Kei ..

description: Good taste, rip off price. Dude I ate my lobster roll in 5 bites. I counted. More like an appetizer. Like I can understand if it's $14 for a lobster roll that was at least bigger than my iPhone, and came with chips or something. I expect to get full on $14. It seriously was as big as my iPhone 4s. Good taste, but no way in hell worth $14.
author: Celeste M.

description:
I was craving some lobster and OTG Pleasant Hill was my chance.  I headed to the long line in front of the Lobsta Truck with my money in hand.  The wait was about 25 minutes but we noticed the orders were getting filled fast.  I ordered a lobster roll, crab roll, clam chowder cup and lobster bisque pint.  Total $45.  A lot for a food truck but lobster prices are high. 

The lobster roll was good.. I opted for mayo topping and it wasn't overwhelming with good chunks.  Crab roll was good, flakes of crab again with mayo covering.  Clam chowder was creamy, flavorful and among the top I've had.  Now the lobster bisque... honestly a fail.  It was basically blended cream!  No chunks of lobster, no nothing but watery cream blend.  I was disappointed since I had opted for the larger pint hoping this would be the highlight of the meal.  I would go back for a lobster roll fix another time but not for my soup craving.
author: Gina W.

description: Poor customer service. Puny 'lobsta' roll. For 14 bucks NOT WORTH IT. Not very fresh either.. very unimpressed.
author: Mark K.

description: Lobsta Truck rocks. If you love lobster, the lobster roll will be perfect for you. It's so simple, yet so satisfying. You get a warm toasty hotdog bun LOADED with lobster, I always get it with butter. It's nothing fancy, but I'm  also eating it in a parking lot. I really like that it's not all creamy and gooey where you have to look for the lobster like most places. They've got it spot on.
author: Nickel C.

description:
I had a chance to try out the Lobsta truck when I went to the Best buy plaza where there were many food trucks that was there as well. I think I only gave it a two star because I couldn't find myself enjoying the crab roll at all and the fact that we waited in line and they ran out of the clam chowder. SADNESS :( Lobster clam chowder sounds pretty damn good to me! 

The crab roll : The only thing I find enjoyable about the crab roll was the bread itself haha. For some reason(even though i like crab) I feel like it was a sandwich that went wrong. It's like putting chocolate in a sandwich...I couldn't figure out what was going on.

Regardless I was quite happy with the lobster roll. It's not because the lobster roll itself would ever get me full but for $12 they gave a HUGE amount of lobster in proportion to the bread that they provided you with. The buttery lobster with the nicely toasted butter bread was quite delicious.

Overall : i would consider going back to try out the clam chowder and I would consider getting lobster roll again but I know I wouldn't find myself be full just eating one lobster roll by myself...or maybe I'm just a fatass. haha
author: Ernest Y.

description:
I didn't have a problem with the portion size of the lobsta roll. In fact, I was pleasantly surprised at how much lobsta they give you. We asked for light butter, which was great because you could still taste the fresh flavor of the lobster itself. I would order it again if I ate something else beforehand. I would probably skip it if it was my only dinner (because I wouldn't be full!)

They ran out of clam chowder by the time we got there, which was disappointing. If the clam chowder is decent, I would round it up to 3.5 stars.
author: Allison S.

description: Their clam chowder is pretty decent. We tried it several times and although not as consistent as others' chowders, it tastes good. A little short on clams, not very thick and the celery and other veggies are cut very Inconsistently so it doesn't distribute very evenly (yes, we stir it up a lot). The prices are crazy high (higher than at nice sit-down restaurants) and the lobster roll is still as ridiculously expensive as it is small (it's appetizer size with a premium entree price). I still don't get this truck, it's got the ingredients to do a great job but somehow missed the mark and the service is a begrudging, so it detracts from what little I do like about it. Lower the prices, pay attention to knife cuts, season a bit more liberally and make the portion size suitable for dinner then this place might just succeed.
author: Bob L.

description: $14 for a roll that was so small I can't believe it I'm in FiDi i know, but I could have gotten an enormous salad or ramen or at lease a sandwich with sides. I'm still hungry. And in the two blocks back to my office it's cold. It tasted good enough. Needs more salt. I'm not going back.
author: Namita K.

description:
I was all excited when my phone get a msg from twitter that lobstatruck will be away from my house about 9 mins :D It was a little hard to be found. but yeah finally we found it hiding in the parking lot. bought the lobster roll, crab roll, and a clam chowder. 
- lobster roll was blank :( not as good as i expected
- crab roll was really good
- i'm in love with their clam chowder
The price ain't cheap but worth the try!
author: Yen L.

description:
Enjoyed a lobster roll with butter and crab roll with mayo. Tried it as MB off the grid. Knew to expect small portions for a food truck meal, so I savored every single bite. 

$13-$14 rolls ($6 for extra meat, that's probably like one extra bite). It's like $3/$4 for 4 bites/mouthfuls. Fresh and tastes like real lobster/crab, no mysterious fillers. Bread was soft and lightly toasted, taste like potato bread. 

I was temped to try the lobster bisque for a $7 cup the size of a gelato cup. Many propel in line were ordering it. 

I wouldn't stand in a long line or go out of my way to eat here. If you can afford it, enjoy.
author: Sarina T.

description: The butter Lobsta roll is quite simply, delicious. So delicious that you mourn how small it is because you can easily eat two but they are $12 each so...  They now offer extra meat for an additional $5.
author: Robin W.

description: Small portion of Lobster Roll disappointed me at first; however, the taste got be thinking that 'I will be back next week.'   My opinion is very credible since I am an ex-Bostonian with ample experiences in 'lobster roll' including the McDonald Lobster Roll [only available in New England].   FYI: McD Lobster Roll sucks.
author: Jake C.

description: The lobster roll had great flavor, some parts of the lobster felt a little over cooked. For $14, it is small especially when compared to other lobster rolls in the bay area. Decent bite, but no value for the price.
author: Dave W.

description: As a former East Coaster, I can say that is pretty darn close to what I'm used to eating when I would go up to Maine. The only problem is how expensive it is, compared to what I would pay in Maine... I guess, because it's 3,000 miles away. Anyway, the price doesn't stop me from satisfying my lobster roll craving, whenever I see this food truck.
author: Erika L.

description:
Lobstatruck changed suppliers and now serves the best lobster roll in California and as good as any of the hundreds I have had in Maine...
Perfect ratio of tail meat to crispy roll
Alameda location is great--would eat there every day if they had a pop up location nearby.
author: Bonnie M.

description: Good but just so expensive. I had a crab roll, just a nicely toasted bun, crab and butter. Was super tasty, but for $13 I would really have liked a little larger roll. But it was really good. Hard to hate on something so tasty and I know crab isn't cheap, but it would be nice to have even a little more.
author: Kyle D.

description:
If you're looking for a really traditional lobster or crab roll like from back east, this is the place to go, or I should say, place to find wherever it is. Their sandwiches have piles of quality lobster and crab in large pieces. I actually ordered one of each and both were really delicious. 

Now, lobster and crab meat really speak for themselves, so they really don't have to do a lot to make the sandwiches taste great. The bread is good and they really offer authentic, east coast style shellfish rolls. 

They are costly, about $10 each, but they are worth it. I guess what keeps me from giving them 5 stars is that the menu really is simplistic and a little boring. Overall though, these guys are good.
author: Brad K.

description:
Ordered a crab roll and a "side" of clam chowder. Apparently side means "largest size we offer". That's on me. I should have been more specific.

The roll itself was about half the meat of what you expect for this kind of thing. I'm comparing it the tourist trap lobster/crab roll shops at the Pier, so our bar is already quite low. It was about 4 bites of food, 1 if you're feeling industrious. It tasted only a bit below average, which is to say it was good, which is to say it wasn't worth $13.

I guess I understand why "side" means "largest size" to them. I should have gotten a side cheeseburger from the next truck over. Maybe a nice side entire ham? A side decision to order from somewhere else to begin with? Too far?

The soup tasted fine, but it didn't really live up to the "clam" part of the promise. Sure it was chowder, but this isn't grad school; 50% is still an F. It was on par with canned soup from Safeway. 

So, yeah, $21 for a can of soup and a wisp of seafood. A solid "meh".
author: Andy M.

description: I always hope that these food trucks will live up to their rep of preparing great food but my lobster roll which was essentially dry did not.  I asked for the mayo one but couldn't even taste the mayo went back to ask for for and they gave me a teaspoon amount! At $14.00 a pop I don't think that would have been their profit.  Mayo didn't really even give the wet lobster any extra flavor.  Bun was toasted well.
author: Alison B.

description:
Note: This review is based solely on the lobster roll. 

It simple and to the point. 
Lobster Roll: warm bread, heaps of lobster, lightly buttered (around $12). 
That's it. 

Don't go in expecting some extravagant herbs, flavors, or additives that make lobster non longer taste like lobster. 
So, if your into simple and clean seafood, this is it. 

I'll chase you down anytime lobsta truck!
author: Jenny A.

description:
Finally caught up with the Lobsta Truck last night at the OC Fair Grounds and it did not disappoint! Soft hot crispy rolls stuffed with fat juicy lobster imported from the East Coast! 

Have been raving about it all day! 

Price is extremely reasonable for the amount of Lobster you get!
author: Mike S.

description: I really like the lobster roll and the clam chowder. The big knock against it is the price, but that's somewhat expected when you are eating lobster (I'd actually be more suspicious if it was really cheap). If you're a big eater and you're hungry (which I happened to be today when I got the roll), you'll probably have to get at least 2, which for lunch is a bit pricey. I just got one to try and went somewhere else to get more food so I don't have to drop another $14 for lunch. Clam chowder was good, but I happened to be walking by the truck one time when they were closing and they just gave it to me for free. It was amazing for a free chowder, but maybe not as much for a $5 chowder. If I didn't account for the price, I'd probably give it a 4 star rating. The $/amount of food ratio just doesn't make it worth it unless I really really really want lobster
author: Edison T.

description:
I'm originally from New England, so I get homesick for a good LobRoll....but go somewhere else. Let's put the high prices aside. We just wanted a couple of decent rolls. My wife and I got the $20 numbers (with extra meat). Supposedly 6 oz. instead of the 4.5 which $14 buys you.
They were waaay overcooked and really chewy. If all you do, basically, is sell lobster rolls, learn how to cook the critters.
author: David D.

description:
I am sorry but the outrageous price for this little bun with either lobster or crab takes away from the experience.   Had this at Larkspur Landing today (3/29).   $19 for ONE litle roll, including $6.00 for "extra meat" and $3.00 for a root beer.   Gawd.   Two people -- 20 seconds to down the "roll" and move on.   No side dish, no cole slaw, chopped anything, just meat on the bun.    Sorry, not good enough.   We could pick up a 2 pound dungeness crab at the market on the way home, and make at least 2 meals from that for 2 adults.
LobstaTruck, stay away.
author: Lloyd L.

description: I tried the Lobster Roll but it is a rip off!!!  Okay, I get it, lobster is expensive, but for $14 I really was expecting more, more lobster, more flavor, etc.....  It is basically like a slice of wonder bread with few chucks of lobster, that is it.  I tried other Lobster rolls places in the bay area and have to say that Woodhouse fish company does it right.  This one is really plain.  Glad that I tried it but will not be going back.
author: Eva E.

description:
I had the lobsta roll (half mayo, half butter). It was pretty darn good and the buttery bread was the perfect compliment to the lobster. However, the price of the SMALL sandwich is far too high, hence my rating.

Btw, in case you're wondering, the butter was better than the mayo.
author: Ami Y.

description: We did the research on offthegridsf before flying in from Michigan. We hit the Minna location between 5th and 6th during lunch. We each had the lobster roll with butter. YUMMY X 2! The bread is perfect for the sandwich/roll they make. Just a perfect combination. Nice portion of lobster too. After each of us finished a roll, we then split a crab roll. That was every bit as good as the lobster roll. Yes, these aren't cheap, but we are talking lobster and crab here, not canned tuna fish! Worth the price, and it made for a positive memorable experience. When were in SF again, we will hit the truck for sure. Recommend!
author: Bri A.

description: I really enjoyed my buttered lobsta roll. Big juicy, plentiful pieces of tasty lobster on a seasoned roll with butter. It was simple, unmasked, and worth $14.  Yes their menu is limited, but that's because they're damn good at what they do. This was my first lobster roll ever and I'm hooked. Will definitely be back on Wednesday nights at off the grid upper haight just to find them.
author: Jamie W.

description:
finally got to try out the lobsta truck at the del mar races this past weekend. yum, yum, YUM!

review is solely for the lobsta rolls! ordered 2, one for me & one for hubby. they offer the lobster tossed with either mayo or butter. i got one with butter and the other (thanks to a friends recommendation) mixed with both mayo & butter-mmm gluttony at its best! both were good but true to reviewers comments, you get more of the lobsta flavor when it's just mixed with butter. despite the long line, we got our food pretty quickly. the roll was still nice and toasty and the lobster was yummy and tender.  

after reading all the reviews...i get it, $12 for a tiny lobsta roll sounds like a lot right? how about, $12 for a perfectly toasted split top roll oozing with lobster goodness. LOBSTER folks. lobster that you usually see at the restaurants and grocery store at market price. yet here we have the lobsta truck, serving up a delicious roll without us having to deal with cooking and prepping the lobster ourselves.

i've been lucky enough to have some yummy lobster rolls back in boston, and i think the lobsta truck does pretty well considering they're bringing the lobster roll scene to cali. i'm glad the lobsta truck now has an OC truck roaming around whenever i need my lobsta roll fix. back in bean town we'd pay anywhere from $18-$24 for a lobster roll...some were worth it and some weren't. in this case i'd say the $12 is worth it bc you get all lobster - no celery/lettuce fillers in these rolls!

$12 still too much? then gitouttaheya (said in my best boston accent=P!!).
author: Belle L.

description: Got the lobster bisque. Don't know I'd they just skimmed it off the surface or if that's what its like but there wasn't s single piece of lobster in the large pint I got. 13 bucks for a tub of reddish creme. Definitely do not recommend.
author: Nicholas N.

description: I was super excited to learn that there would be a Lobster truck at Off the Grid Fort Mason...unfortunately it was a disappointment. I wasn't terribly hungry so I just got a cup of the lobster bisque. It was on the small side but still tasted like it had an entire stick of butter in it. The texture reminded me of watery cottage cheese and it left an odd, unpleasant aftertaste in my mouth. Maybe the lobster roll is worth a try but I will not be back for the bisque.
author: Cara K.

description:
yes this truck is expensive...but it's lobster!!!! and from what I can tell..it seems like all lobster tail meat. That's just insanely awesome!

Their lobsta roll with butter is just .... I don't even know the word for it. It's so simple, yet so YUMMY! it's the simple things in life that make my tummy happy! The bread is toasted perfectly with massive sized lobster pieces. It is on the pricey side of $12 a pop...but hey...it's lobsta~!!! it's gooooooooood!
author: Kim T.

description: It is Sooo small. Nothing special, very small, nothing on the side, 14 bucks. What do you expect
author: Nlza G.

description: This is a very popular dish in Maine and other places on the northeastern seaboard. The lobsta roll is awesome! You have a choice of butter or mayo. I recommend butter to bring out the sweetness of the lobster. It will definitely give you an OMG moment or two. They fly their lobsters out 3-times a week from Maine so you know that you're getting the freshest lobsters in SoCal. They also sell a Pennsylvania Dutch favorite, Whoopie Pie, which are concave chocolate cakes and creamy vanilla filling in the middle, kind of like a Suzie Q, but round. It really hits the spot when you need sweet fix. Thumbs up!
author: Chelsea M.

description: Tried this lobster roll today in Marin and the lobster was cold. In my opinuin the food is over priced for the portion I received.
author: JJ S.

description:
I was excited to hear Lobsta Truck now has an OC outpost. I had a stellar lobster roll at Luke's Lobster in NYC last year and have been craving that same experience here in OC/LA. This past Friday, they were part of the food truck meet up in Fullerton in the Best Buy parking lot on Imperial and Harbor. Food roundup:

Lobster roll: Comes on a traditional grilled split roll (not hotdog bun), with big chunks of chilled lobster meat (I think tail and claw). Got half mayo and half butter. I liked the butter side a tad more since it gave it a salty kick the mayo side was missing. The lobster was cooked perfectly and it tasted really fresh and clean.

Lowdown: Great place for your lobster roll fix, reasonable price for the amount of lobster you get. Granted, this is not going to get you completely full, but hey, it's a lobster roll for $12. The meat wasn't as sweet as the one I had in NYC, but lobster is cooked well. I'll be back, mmmm! Also from their website: AS A RESULT, LIKE THE LOBSTER, WE GET OUR BREAD FRESH FROM NEW ENGLAND, score!

**For all you concerned with price: You're getting high quality lobster for a decent price! When I was in NYC, you'd be lucky to find any place with a roll for less than $25, a lot of places there start around $25-$32 for a bit larger roll with fries in a sit down place. Even Luke's Lobster in NYC, a modest order at the counter joint charges $15. Just to give some perspective for all you not familiar with how much these things run (outside of Maine which I imagine is cheaper). 

Reality check: If you want to get full off a lobster roll with at least 1/2 lb of meat in it or more, you gotta pay more than $12!!!!

http://laist.com/2010/07/22/lobster_rolls.php#photo-1
author: Jackie P.

description: Good lobster and decent buttery flavor on mediocre bread. $12 is pretty expensive for what you get though, which is a very small roll (think the size of a regular toast folded in half) with a disappointing amount of lobster. Wouldn't get again for the price.
author: Yian L.

description: I had a very good experience to try their Lobster roll at the Pleasanton Off the Grid last Sunday.  It was very tasty and worth the money! I paid $14.00 for a sandwich that was filled up with a lot of lobster meat, amazing!  And the lobster meat had good quality, fresh, tasty, and cooked right.  I don't understand why people complain about the price because this is Lobster we are talking about, do they know how much it cost to eat a lobster sandwich at a restaurant???  I highly recommend this if you are a lobster fan, it is totally worth it!
author: Chris H.

description:
Yes I know, these lobsta rolls are pretty expensive for $12 a pop but I can't help being in love with them!

LOBSTA ROLL WITH BUTTER-I love the toasted buttery roll these use to sandwich their chunks of lobster in. I think they give you an okay amount of lobster, but I won't lie one lobster roll does not fill me up at all but I don't have the heart to drop $36 just to be full. These lobsta rolls are more of a snack since they are pretty small.I always go with the lobsta roll with butter since I hate mayo but if you like mayo, go for it.

CLAM CHOWDER-I LOVE their clam chowder and I think it is decently priced compared to their lobsta rolls. It is $7 a pint and it is really good. It isn't too salty or too creamy like some clam chowders and the seafood taste in the chowder is really fresh and isn't sickening after a couple bites. I usually get sick of clam chowders after a small bowl or two but I can eat a pint of this clam chowder all by myself. I suggest taking a pint home, picking up some sourdough or french bread at a grocery store on the way and dipping it in the chowder while enjoying your favorite movie. 

I wish they would lower the price for these rolls or I would become a millionaire so I could eat them everyday....hopefully both will come true!
author: Carol N.

description: OTG Alameda- We almost went to Señor Sisig but when we saw your truck we thought we'd give it a try.    So My husband walks over to where we're sitting and offered me a bite and I almost refused but I wanted to see if the taste made up for the small roll ($14 for hotdog bun size- ouch) and sadly it did NOT make up for the size- it needed more seasoning it was just... disappointing.
author: Dani R.

description:
The Lobsta Truck is a New England style of eating Lobster.  If you have been back east (Boston area) and had a Lobster Roll you will realize everything including the roll is authentic New England fare.  You are getting real New England Lobster meat too. For $12.00, which may sound a little steep, you are getting the real deal.  it is delicious and worth every penny. Try buying a Lobster at a local restaurant and see how much you will pay.  I like the Lobster roll with Butter. It is amazing.

The clam chowder soup is rich and has Avery good flavor to it.
author: Jim P.

description: Very disappointed with the lobster rolls the quantity and quality. Quantity: regular @ $14 was pretty skimpy on the lobster, and you barely tell the difference from the one we ordered with extra meat @ $20. Quality: lobster with butter was juicy and tender, but very bland. We're going to stick with Sam's Chowdermobile in the future.
author: Monica W.

description:
Ok I wish I could give like a 3.5 since i feel they dont quite deserve a 4 but 3 is a little low...... so I walked outside of my salon to say hi to the people at the flower shop behind it and holy crap lobsta truck! I pretty much ran across the street to squeeze in the back of the line. Excitedly I placed my order for a lobsta roll with butter (Mayo and I are sworn enemies) and a blueberry soda. I got halfway through the soda and my order came up. I pulled the red checkered paper down from the truck greedily and was immediately disappointed. It was so tiny! $14.50 for lunch I figured I'd be able to fill up on awesomeness and be full for a while.

Well I popped a little piece of the butter coated lobster in my mouth and my hope was restored! Yum! It was sweet and fresh and buttery goodness in a toasted roll of awesome (Brioche maybe?) I savored every amazing bite for as long as possible but too quickly it was gone...... much too quickly.  Disappointed in my lack of hunger satisfaction I finished my (awesome) blueberry soda and trudged to my car. 

I guess in Costa mesa on the border of new port beach those portion sizes and prices are ok. But if you're looking for sustainability for a good price this isn't your truck.
author: Kayla C.

description: I decided to check out the Lobsta Truck at OTG in Larkspur Sunday afternoon.  The lobster was well cooked, but I have to say that I was really disappointed with the amount of lobster on the roll.  I'm use to Sam's Chowder mobile and the Old Port Lobster Shack.  I just don't feel like a got my money's worth.  I also got the crab roll and the lobster bisque and felt cheated by the lack of meat.  They do allow you to purchase extra meat, but I feel that I shouldn't  have to do that.  If you can't get to OPLS or Sam's, and you're having a lobster craving, they will do, if you get extra meat.
author: Gia N.

description: I never tried a crab roll before, but have always wanted one.  The Sandwich was absolutely prefect,  so fresh and savory.  The only issue I had was that it was a fairly small size for the price but I understand because of the high price of crab.  But I will definitely seek out the Lobsta Truck again for another sando.
author: Sam d.

description:
Ok so I finally got to try the Lobsta truck after seeing it around. I was really excited to eat the lobsta roll with butter. I decided to split it with my sis since we were going to get a couple of other items from the other trucks. Ordering wad quick and easy. When I picked up my lobsta roll I was so so so sad that it was so so so tiny! I mean the thing doesn't even look like 6"... Whaaaat??!!

Any ways after cutting the tiny roll in half. I bit into it.... And the lobster was very juicy , tasty and mmmm buttery. The roll was good too! It was crispy and buttery on the outside and soft on the inside.  I finished it in one more bite. How sad. I gave it 3 stars because of the size and price. If they kept it that size I think it should be a Lil less than $12. Other than that I would of given it 5 stars. I wouldn't eat this again for $12 I would need to buy at least 3 of the Rolls to fill my tiny belly and that would be $36 for a sandwich...hmmm pass
author: Couture C.

description: Really disappointed in the lobster roll.  Mealy lobster with no seasoning and very dry even though we asked for the mayo.  Not making that mistake again.  Loved the Maine Root Beer though!
author: Will B.

description:
I had the opportunity to try this food truck today at 12:06 pm... I ordered the Lobster Roll with Butter $12.00 and the Lemon lemonade.. 

First it's tiny for $12.00... it looked like a stuff taco or mini burrito. Yes they did packed it with lots of flavorless lobster and that's about it. This lobster roll is a memorable little sandwich but not due to the taste rather the lack off any sort of taste. When you adventure into eating something like this you want to remember it for the rest of your life just as you remember the first time you stuck  your tongue in and electrical socket or one of those square batteries sending electrical sensations throughout your taste buds, but sadly all I'll remember is the price and what the meal was missing. 


Note to cook how about maybe adding a little bit of seasoning to the lobster not to much just a wink... maybe a dash of paprika on the meat would be nice... or on the mayo how about some scallions to bring out the flavor of the meat .... So for $12.00 I do expect a little more than a buttered dinner roll and some flavorless could be out of the can Lobster...
author: Juan P.

description: Lobsta roll way too small for $14 and was not good. Chowder was decent so they get a star for that
author: Ryan C.

description: I always look for the Lobsta truck when they're in Irvine for "Truck Day" at the Michelson lot. The lobster and crab rolls are fantastic, simple fare....made with really fresh seafood.
author: T. J. K.

description: The price is well worth the quantity of lobster that they put into the roll. I have to agree with the previous post though, that the bread was not my favorite, but I can overlook the cheap buttered bread, for the main attraction the Lobster! I actually tried both the butter (which I got on the side), and the seasoned mayo. I liked the mayo more than the butter. The butter should have been salted, with a couple splashes of lemon, maybe then it would have been better than the mayo. I will definitely come back to the Lobsta Truck if they hit the SOMA area again. 4 stars for the quantity and quality of the lobster, and a reasonable price. The crab roll was really yummy as well. Can't hardly wait for you guys to come back to 5th & Minna.
author: Mike M.

description: OTG Oakland, the Lobsta Truck is indeed on point, it's higher than the other trucks, but it is definitely worth it.  You have to get the Lobster Roll.
author: Lonnie J.

description: Spotted this truck on my way home and thought of trying their stuff atleast once. The lobsta roll was good although it was a bit pricey for me. Still they have quite a unique selection so I'm thinking of trying out the rest next time.
author: Samir C.

description: Lobster roll is ok for a food truck. Sorry I had to add Sriracha for that extra punch, to one side of course.
author: Steve K.

description:
To say that the Lobsta Roll was not good would be a lie. The bread was perfectly toasted. The lobster was tender and fresh. The butter was the smooth flavor that combined the two elements together to create a light but rich lobsta roll experience.

So why doesn't this get a higher score?

Because you're paying $12 fricken dollars for something you can eat in four bites, that's why.

I don't care how good your stuff is. If it comes from a truck, if it doesn't fill you, and if it's not the most amazing thing on sliced bread, it should not be that expensive.

Plus $3 for a bottle of soda.

Shame on you Lobsta Truck. At a reasonable price, you coulda been a contdenda.
author: Andrew B.

description: Tonight at PH BART station - lobster not good - overcooked, tough, and old/fishy tasting.  Paid for extra meat too.  Threw 3/4 of it away - waste of $20.  So disappointed its usually really good and I was looking forward to a great dinner tonight.
author: P O.

description: You have to get there early.  I didn't get any lobster but I made it for the crab roll.  There was 3 orders after us and it was all gone.  To appease the remaining customers in the line, they offered a free small clam chowder.  I think it is hard to estimate the amount of customers they are going to get and if you want things fresh, there will be estimation errors (more shortfalls since it is to their benefit not to waste).  I thought the prices would be lower since there was an oversupply of lobsters on the east coast.  I think prices there this season was $4 a lb.  I haven't tried the mayo but the butter was great!  The sandwich is small but it is a very rich dish so it was enough for me.  Gotta try it!
author: F O.

description:
Last Friday, there was a gathering of food trucks in the Best buy parking lot on the corner of Imperial and Harbor, this is borderline La Habra/Fullerton.  There were many trucks and this was one of the trucks that was there.

I have never had a Lobster roll before, and my experience of a lobster roll is from seeing it on TV on the Food Network.  My brother has told me of a place in NY but I live in Cali so I suppose this is the closest I can get until I venture up and east to NYC.  Anyways, the Lobsta Truck didn't have a big line went we started but I wanted to give it a try.  We just ordered one roll and shared.  I agree for $12 its a small portion if you're a hungry man (my boyfriend ate his half in maybe three bites, me I took like 4-5 bites), but it's MF-ing lobster people, LOBSTER!!  I think for me my mistake was ordering it with the mayo, thinking it will be spread on like a sandwich.  I was wrong, it was tossed in the mayo.  I should have ordered it with the butter, as many others had done after us.  Nonetheless, it was still fairly tasty, though you could not taste the freshness of the lobster through the mayo.

If I see this truck again, lobster roll with butter, maybe a better bet.
author: Jennifer N.

description: I'm always hesitant about ordering shellfish from a truck, mostly because the thought of spending hours sitting or bent over a toilet isn't my idea of a good time. Fortunately, I've had the Lobsta Truck a handful of times and have yet to regret it later. The Lobsta Truck keeps things simple, and their only offering is essentially a lobster roll with butter or mayo. The menu has a few other things (like a crab roll or clam chowder), but honestly the only reason you'd come here is for the lobster roll. Unless you're the kind of person who sees a place called 'Lobsta Truck' and thinks to themselves that's where they have to try the crab. Don't be that guy. Nobody likes that guy.
author: Eatosaurus R.

description: THE VERY BEST!! I was raised in New England, and can honestly say that everything Lobsta Truck serves is SUPERB! They are as unique and authentic as any lobster stand back east..Everything on their menu is so fresh, yummy, and very resonably priced....Look for them, they're all over...ENJOY!
author: Nancy W.

description:
I do have to say that I have never had lobster before, yet have always had a strange craving/want to eat a lobster roll.. so when i was driving home and A yelled out lobsta truck, i literally screamed with joy. hehe.

The lobster roll was a bit small, but I guess we are getting a good deal so I am fine with that, the service is quick if you are able to get a head in line :) The clam chowder is also yummy, full of lots of clam bits and other veggies.

However, after eating the lobster roll I realized it wasn't exactly what I thought it would be. FOr some reason I imagined sizzling lobster on a hot roll. But overall everything was kind of cold, so I was a little sad, but I guess that's how it is? No idea actually. Anyway, that's why I'm giving it three stars. Not because the service was terrible or the food was bad. I'm just not that big of a fan I guess.
author: Joy K.

description:
3.5 stars

Got the lobsta roll with butter.  Very good.  Lobster was fresh bread was excellent and had a nice little toast to it.  Perfect amount of butter (not too much) and a pretty good amount of lobster.  Basic and very good.  The service was good too.  Received food fast and girls were friendly and nice.

There are a few things that keep this truck from being a 4.5/5 star truck.  The main one is the prices.  The lobsta roll is 12 bucks (crab roll 11).  That is just too pricey for a 5 inch sandwich.  I know quality lobster is expensive and they do give you a pretty good amount of meat but 8 to10 bucks would be a fair price for what they are serving.

Very good truck (above avg) but not spectacular, overpriced, but I would like to try the crab roll and the clam chowder if I ever get the chance to go back.
author: Mr W.

description: Started with 3 stars because...lobster. BUT, minus one star for the sandwich being the size of a dinner roll. Subtracted another star because the guy taking the order has ZERO customer service skills. He seemed angry to be there. I mean, wouldn't you be smiling if you just sold a $3 two-bite hors d'oeuvres for a whopping $14! Ka-Ching!
author: Sydney R.

description: Lobster Roll = amazing. Priced high but its lobster so its understandable. On the small size but still very D licious!!
author: Mark R.

description: Went to Off the Grid in Millbrae today and tried the crab roll with butter.  The bun was perfectly toasted.  The crab was fresh, rich, and delicious.
author: Leila ..

description: My husband and I ordered your crab and lobster rolls plus we got clam chowder and lobster bisque. Everything was really good. I really like that you have the butter options for the rolls because I'm not a huge fan of mayo. The lobster bisque was really good I ended up not sharing. Definitely put this truck at the top of my food truck list.
author: Heather L.

description: The lobsta truck is awesome, I go visit them at least once a week. They have great food and friendly service. Their prices are reasonable and quality of meat is excellent. Definitely recommend anyone who hasn't had a lobster roll before to definitely check these guys out.
author: Shannon S.

description: Yummy  is written all over this truck, however portions are smaller than expected.
author: Marisol G.

description: Hate to ding a place for charging too much but that's what this place does. I understand lobster and crab is expensive, but this place still over charges for what it is. I had both the lobsta and crab roll.....There isn't a whole lobster or crab on it, its more like 1/2. The taste isn't really great either, over buttered and the bread gets soagy fast. You are much better off going to the supermarket and making it yourself.
author: James C.

description: Sooo freaking good. Second time having the lobster roll with butter at the OC fair grounds. I don't think I will ever be able to pass up their truck! Pricey but totally worth it!
author: Jen P.

description: I finally tried a lobsta sandwich yesterday, and I was quite impressed.  The lobsta meat is stuff into a roll that is lightly buttered with garlic.   You can order the sandwich with either mayo or butter.  Or you can order a mayo sandwich with butter on the side.  Light mayo is another option as well.  While the chucks of meat are very large, the sandwich is very small.  It's about the size of a hot bun and it will not fill you up if you're hungry.  For $12, I expect a bigger sandwich but that's the only real drawback.  The sandwich is delicious.  The bun compliments the meat perfectly.  I ordered the light mayo sandwich and it had a light creamy taste without feeling artery clogging.  Be warned, the wait is very long.  I visited the truck at Irvine Lanes which had several other trucks there.  None of the other trucks had a line except for the Lobsta Truck which was about a 40 minute wait.  I'm not sure any sandwich is worth a 40 minute wait but YMMV.
author: Steve L.

description: So, obviously this lobster roll is not as good as one you may find in Maine, and also obviously, it is a lot more expensive.  That being said, I don't think this lobster roll is expensive because it is a lobster roll! Unless you are right in a fishing town where they trap lobster, it will always be expensive. This lobster roll was tasty.  I ordered the regular one and was still hungry.  I recommend the extra meat roll ($20).
author: Julia W.

description:
Loved the crab roll!! Sure it was $11 and it was a little on the small side but the crab was fresh and sweet and piled high onto the buttery roll.  I am a small girl and I probably could eat two.

Worth every bite.  Normally I would spend $12 on a sushi roll easy and with this sandwich, you get so much more crab.

Service was really fast, even with a lot of people around.
author: jen k.

description:
i tried your lobster on a roll last week in novato,cal.
very good,as good as the lobster roll which is served at
sam's chowder house in half moon bay,cal.
my lobster sandwich has a  little better flavor because i
use potato bread which is sized for hot dogs and hamburgers.
the brand i use is baked by orowheat.



                  nat m.       7/27/14
author: Nat M.

description: I had the pleasure of tasting dee-licious food from the Lobsta Truck. Headed over to SOCO farmer market to check-out the line-up of trucks and knew I wanted some seafood. The line was not too long but once my food came out the crowd began to grow. Ordered the Lobsta roll and lemonade. You think pricey for a $12 sandwhich but once you take a bite of the crispy bead with lobster it's totally worth every dollar. Got the roll with butter, not a big fan of mayo. The lobster meat tasted fresh and the bread was perfectly toasted. Washed it down with the lemonade and it hit the spot. Can't wait to try the clam chowder next time.
author: Cristy M.

description: Tried the crab roll and the lobster roll, both with mayo, like I had in New Hampshire/Massachusetts. Lobster roll tasted better, but both were excellent. Fresh squeezed lemonade was pretty good too...a little on the tarty side, just the way I like it. The cost is pretty steep, especially for the three-bite portion you're given. It's kinda like paying $5 for a $1 street taco.
author: Dennis R.

description: MMM... tried lobster.. i mean Lobsta.. truck for the first time in the OC. The Clam Chowder is amazinggg. Definitely try it. Another classic item to order from their menu is the Lobster roll. It's lobser wrapped in a some kind of bread roll with either mayo, butter, or both. This is also a definite must try. The only thing that caught my attention was the price and the size of the lobster roll. The lobster roll is $12 and it pretty small. But I guess it is a reasonable price since the lobster, according to the website, is fresh!
author: Toni R.

description: I gotta give a big shout out and thank you to the Lobsta Truck for having an amazing menu and awesome customer service. When we rolled up yesterday, the truck was already closed but the dude inside made two last minute sandwiches for us. They were delicious and so was the lemonade. Thanks for being cool.
author: Jonathan B.

description: The food quality is good, but the prices are too high. I paid $14 for a lobster roll, and the small size of it was a shock. Some pictures posted by the other users don't properly convey the scale, so the best description I can think of is this: The folded paper tray they put the sandwich in is used as condiment containers at other restaurants. I'd say the bun is about 4 inches long, and the whole sandwich was gone in three bites. As a standalone review, I would have given them 3.5 stars, but I bumped it down because I felt the 5-star reviews needed some countering here.
author: J. P.

description: Walked 3 miles to this truck as it was hyped and came to San Francisco.  Really disappointed with the tiny portion of a Lobsta roll we received for $14.
author: Seasbass A.

description: Finally tried the lobsta truck. First it was really good, cook perfectly & you have a choice of butter or mayo. I chose butter & it just melted in my mouth. The problems are it's very expensive at $12 for a 3 bite lobsta roll. I kinda felt ripped off. Don't get me wrong, it was good but wouldn't come back cuz of the price & size. There lemonade is awesome though
author: David M.

description: Simple sandwich.... Lobsta roll. Simply deelicious. Packed heavy with what youre paying for... Lobsta! But who would ever ruin lobster with mayo!?
author: Jeremy C.

description:
I was honestly a little disappointed with this truck, especially considering that I was looking forward to it so much before today. I was aware of the prices even before today so they weren't a surprise when I saw them. The big letdowns were the portions and, well, the amount of flavor. Don't get me wrong, I love lobster with every bit of my being. I love its natural buttery richness and the orgy is creates in your mouth when you add actual butter on top of it. However, the butter lobster roll just didn't really do it for me. It was definitely buttery but I guess I was just expecting some other flavors to be present besides butter, so to me it seemed rather bland and boring. Also, as I mentioned, the portion of the sandwich was extremely small in my opinion; all they did was put some chunks of lobster in a buttered-up slice of normal bread and served it. It was really nothing special. Price usually doesn't bother me, but $12 for what I got was a little ridiculous. I think $8 or $9 would be a bit more reasonable.

I am definitely not trying to discourage others from trying the Lobsta truck, I am simply giving a heads up to those who might actually think twice about these kinds of things. While I was a little disappointed overall, there are still other things I would like to try on their menu such as the clam chowder, and for that I will give them another try.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Tasty stuff.  I have to admit that lobster doesn't float my boat as much as it does other people so if you're one of them take my review with a grain of salt.  My wife and I picked up the crab and lobsta rolls when the truck was in Fullerton tonight.  Pay attention to when they say they're serving cause even though they're there 30 minutes prior (as is their fan line), they don't open until they're good an ready, which  tonight was 5 minutes later than advertised.  
Once they are open, the system runs pretty efficiently and the service is friendly.  We ended up getting 2 rolls apiece which fills you up, but not over the top.  The bread is a little overbuttered for my taste, however.  All in all, $46 for the two of us.  If it were $30, I'd give it 4 stars but overall, the quality was good.
author: Andrew P.

description: I suppose the $12 price tag is in line for a lobster roll, but it seemed a little on the pricey side for what you get.  It tasted good, don't get me wrong, but mine didn't fill me up, and I'm not a big eater.  A $12.00 sammich should at least fill a dude up.
author: Chris A.

description: Yum. Not the cheapest, not the healthest, but the worthest because the yummest!
author: Stephanie R.

description: I understand that lobster is quite expensive, but the price really is much too expensive for what you get.  I got the lobsta roll and I was able to eat it in like 5 bites.  It's sooo small and doesn't fill you up at all.  The lobster itself is very good, but I just can't get over how small it is!  They take ONE piece of toast, fold it in half and fill that with the lobster.  So yeah, it's TINY.  I absolutely do not believe that they are stuffing even CLOSE to $12 worth of lobster in there.  And the roll was ready super super fast, so I dunno how hard the prep is...  It was a nice novelty, but I won't be eating there again.
author: Christine L.

description: I had hopes of a tasty new England dinner for the 4th of July weekend.  I purchased a lobster roll and a cup of clam chowder.  The lobster roll was a bland bit of lobster on a piece of toast and a so so cup of chowder.  One of my friends bought the crab roll and said it was very tasty.
author: Joe C.
